incidents.narrative: Four acquaintances who had been staying together at an Economy Inn were shot in their room on a Saturday morning. Three died at the scene; a fourth died of his injuries several days later. Scott A. Goodwin-Bey was charged with four counts of murder, but those charged were later dropped.
incidents.weapon: Ruger 9-millimeter semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: James Larry told police he was angry his family were infidels who would not conform to his Muslim culture. He shot and killed his pregnant wife, young son and three other family members. He pleaded guilty and was imprisoned without possibility of parole.
incidents.weapon: Handgun – Hi-Point 9mm semiautomatic pistol, Model C9

incidents.narrative: The theft of a cheap bracelet ended in three shootings, including a drive-by that sprayed bullets at a funeral crowd, killing four teens. Jeffrey Best, Robert Bost and Orlando Carter received life without parole. Two others got 54 and 30 years in prison.
incidents.weapon: AK-47 (Simms), .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun (Bost), 9mm semiautomatic handgun (Best)

incidents.narrative: Four adults were shot dead in the front yard of an unlicensed boarding house in the Northridge neighborhood of Los Angeles. Ka Pasasouk, on probation at the time, was arrested the next day in Las Vegas. He has pleaded not guilty to four counts of murder and was sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic Handgun - From the Criminal Complaint filed ……..(“It is further alleged as to count(s) 1, 2, 3 and 4 that said defendant(s), KA PASASOUK personally and intentionally discharged a firearm, a handgun , which caused great bodily injury and death to JENNIFER KIM, TEOFILO NAVALES, ROBERT CALABIA, AMANDA GHOSSEIN – AND……… WITH A SEMIAUTOMATIC FIREARM, in violation of PENAL CODE SECTION 245(b), a Felony, was committed by KA PASASOUK Criminal Complaint Charge)

incidents.narrative: Two brothers have each been charged with four counts of murder and two counts of robbery in the slayings of four women inside an apartment. Police said robbery was the motive. Cedric D. Poore and James S. Poore were both sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber shells found by victims.

incidents.narrative: A 67-year-old woman and her daughter, granddaughter and great-grandson were found after a house fire. They had been stabbed or died in the blaze. Alexander Hill Jr., who was arrested a year later in Buffalo, was charged with four counts of murder. He was convicted and sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: Two victims stabbed with knife, 2 died of smoke inhalation

incidents.narrative: In an apparently hate-inspired, anti-immigrant attack, the gunman traveled over 600 miles from suburban Dallas to an El Paso Wallmart to commit the shooting.
Travane Jackson and Jerrica Spellman had a years-long “ongoing domestic violence situation” before Spellman and her three young children were stabbed to death in thier apartment.

Two years after police found the bodies of three suffocated children, the body of their mother was found in a shallow grave 20 miles away. Pedro Rodriguez, 28, who was found hanged in the family's home, is believed to have killed all four.

An FBI report found 18-year-old Sulejman Talovic "sought to kill as many people as possible" when he entered Trolley Mall and began shooting. Five died and four were injured. Talovic was killed by police. There is no indication why he went on his rampage.
incidents.weapon: Mossberg 88 pistol-grip pump-action shotgun and a Smith & Wesson .38 Special, Model 36 revolver

incidents.narrative: This case remains unsolved. Four young adults were found shot in the head inside a run-down house. The gunman had forced his way in. Police believe the shooting was part of an ongoing feud between two neighborhood groups.

Robert Bever, 18, and Michael Bever, 16, were arrested after police found five of their family members stabbed dead in their home. A 13-year-old girl was injured in the attack; a 2-year-old was unharmed. Both teens were convicted adn sentenced to life without parole.

Dressed in body armor, the gunman opened fire in Dayton’s Oregon District, outside the 400 block of East 5th Street and amid a busy nightlife scene of bars and restaurants. With police already patrolling the area, the shooter was killed quickly preventing many more casualties.  But by using a .223-caliber high capacity magazine,  the gunman was able to shoot off dozens of rounds.
incidents.weapon: Wearing body armor and had a 0.223 caliber long gun, high capacity magazines, and extra ammunition. Shot gun left in car.

incidents.narrative:
According to an affidavit of probable cause, social services representatives came to apartment for an unannounced visit. After there was no answer, the representative contacted a maintenance worker at the complex. When the maintenance worker gained access to the apartment, he found two women, mother and daughter, dentified as Shana and Dominique Decree, in bed. The worker reported that the two seemed disoriented and the apartment was in disarray. Morrisville police were called to the scene and both were taken to the hospital.  

The two women are each facing five counts of criminal homicide as well as one count of conspiracy to commit criminal homicide. 

The victims were  identified as Shana Decree’s children Naa’Irah Smith, 25, and Damon Decree Jr., 13; Shana Decree’s sister, Jamilla Campbell, 42; and Campbell’s 9-year-old twin daughters, Imani and Erika Allen. Another relative, Campbell’s 17-year-old son, Joshua, has been found unharmed, authorities said. 

There is the suggestion of some type of religious ritual or suicide pact.
incidents.weapon: Asphyxiation and strangulation

incidents.narrative: Stemming from an ongoing dispute and apparently precipitated by his recent eviction from his mobile home, Claude Adams, 64,fatally shot Kurt Bracke and Richard Hanen at the park’s clubhouse area, police said. Adams then killed his wife and son and set fire tot eh mobile home before taking his own life.

Four Oakland police officers, including two SWAT team members, were killed after a wanted man was pulled over in a traffic stop. Lovelle Mixon, 26, holed up in his sister's apartment and shot at police before he was killed. A fifth officer was injured.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun at traffic stop – “SKS rifle” - San Jose Mercury News Editorial (The most recent story)

incidents.narrative: A 14-month-old boy was spared in the slayings of a woman, her boyfriend and two of her nephews. Her former boyfriend and the father of the child, Gevante E. Anderson, was found guilty of first-degree murder and sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 40-caliber semiautomatic handgun (casings only) (Weapon not recovered so no make and mode availablel), knife

incidents.narrative: Chrisdale Careaga and her son/stepson were killed in their home, which was then burned. Her husband, John, was found the next day in his car, murdered and the car burned as well. They have a suspect named Danie Kelly Jr, but they have not started to prosecute. Marijuana plants and 60,000 were found in the home.

James and Donovan Cloud (with the possible assistance of two others) killed fatally shot 4 victims at a residence in the Yakima Indian Reservation, stole a car from there and shot more victims, killing 1,  inside a car nearby. The murders appear to be drug-related.

Chad Isaak, a veteran and chiropractor, went to the company that managed his mobile home park and shot and stabbed four employees there. It remains unclear if he had any relationship with the victims or what the precise motive was.
incidents.weapon: Gun, knife

incidents.narrative: Five people were killed and several more injured in a shooting during a packed Halloween party (with over 100 in attendance) at a rented Airbnb home in Orinda, CA. The authorities identified the four people killed as Tiyon Farley, 22, of Antioch, Omar Taylor, 24, of Pittsburg, Ramon Hill Jr., 23, of San Francisco and Oakland, Javin County, 29, of Sausalito and Richmond, and Oshiana Tompkins, 19, of Vallejo and Hercules
incidents.notes: On November 21, 2019, the Contra Costs Sheriff's Department and Federal Agents arrested two more suspects on weapons and child endangerment charges, seizing a gun linked to this and multiple other shootings

incidents.narrative: Robert Kenneth Stewart entered a nursing home where his estranged wife worked and fatally shot seven elderly patients and a nurse. He said he had taken too many sleeping pills and could not be held responsible. He was sentenced to at least 142 years.
incidents.weapon: Shotgun, .22-cal rifle

incidents.narrative: An illegal immigrant from Mexico, Isabel Martinez, had just lost her father whom she believed was going to hell. One night she stabbed her husband and five children. After being apprehended, she refused a lawyer and smiled for cameras. Possible mental illness, especially depression following loss of father.

Jennifer and Sarah Hart, two white women, adopted six black children. While they appeared to be a happy family, the two neglected and abused the children. The children were described as obedient "robots" who were harshly disciplined for minor infractions, such as laughing at the dinner table. The children complained on multiple occassions that they were not fed as a punishment, and often appeared malnourished. In one instance, Hannah jumped out of the second story window and fled to a neighbor's house, telling them that she had been whipped by her parents. Devonte repeatedly came to a neighbor's house to ask for food, asking the neighbor not to tell his parents. When the neighbor eventually called CPS, the Harts took the children and drove off a cliff three days later. They have records of child abuse and neglect in three different states dating back to 2013. Jennifer was driving, but there is evidence that Sarah googled "suicide" and "drowning" prior to the murders.

incidents.casenickname: Renee Jennex Small Family Home Shooting/Arson Fire
incidents.narrative: A drunken James Steven Jennex sent a text message to a friend apologizing in advance for his actions and then fired a bullet into the heads of each of three developmentally disabled men in his care before setting his Temecula-area home ablaze and killing himself with a .357 revolver blast to the head.  The fire at the Renee Jennex Small Family Home, killed a fourth developmentally disabled man and burned all five people beyond recognition. Investigators pulled a gas can from the rubble.
incidents.weapon: Gun and fire
incidents.notes: The Renee Jennex Small Family Home was a facility licensed to care for up to four developmentally-disabled residents.

incidents.narrative: James Harrison. 34, fatally shot his five children, ages 7 to 16, in the middle of the night after a fight with his wife. His wife was with another man and planned to leave Harrison, according to police reports. The next morning, Harrison killed himself.
incidents.weapon: 2 rifles

incidents.narrative: As a family meal began, Devan Kalathat, 42, shot his wife and two children; his brother-in-law and the man’s wife and infant daughter; and finally, himself. Only his wife survived. Police believe a feud fueled the violence.
incidents.weapon: Pair of .45-cal handguns purchased 1 and 6 weeks before killing

incidents.narrative: The 33-year-old man fatally stabbed four people (including two at his apartment complex) and injured two others in series of attacks over three hours that involved robbery. He was arrested at a 7/11 where he had killed a security guard before he was arrested,

Four residents of an apartment building died in a fire set in the laundry room. A resident heard saying he hated the place was tried twice on homicide and arson charges. The jury deadlocked both times. Charges have been dropped. The case remains open.
incidents.weapon: Accelerant such as paint thinner or lighter fluid

incidents.narrative: Jacob Levi Shaffer is serving life sentences for killing six people, including his estranged wife and her teenage son. Hours before killing his wife's family, he beat to death a man at an Alabama marble company owned by his wife's relatives.
incidents.weapon: Large kitchen knives

incidents.narrative: Adrian Burks went to the house where his girlfriend was staying, got in an argument and killed her and the other three people who lived there, including a 3-year-old girl. He pleaded guilty to the four shootings and received life in prison.
incidents.weapon: "Long black gun"

incidents.narrative: Faced with the possibility of his wife leaving him, Christopher A. Wood shot her and their three young children. He then wrote suicide notes and mutilated the bodies before committing suicide. An autopsy found he was on medication for depression.
incidents.weapon: Excam Model GT 27 .25-caliber Semiautomatic handgun (serial # Serial #20156) killed the victims, and a the killer used a Winchester Sears & Roebuck Ted Williams Pump Action Model 200 .20-gauge shotgun(serial# Serial #2732310) to commit suicide.  He also used a “ginzu-styled” knife and a Corona Professional Folding Razor Tooth Pruning Saw to decapitate, or nearly decapitate, his family post-mortem.

incidents.narrative: David Scott Braswell, 53, Matthew Aaron Barber, 26, Jacob Derr, 25,  and Brian Lee Satterfield, 41, were shot and their bodies burned in a deliberately-set house fire, all believed to be connected to narcotics trafficking. The fire appears to have been set to cover-up the murders.
Four Detroit residents, including a pregnant woman, were found shot at a vacant city-owned house that had been raided repeatedly as a drug den. No arrests have been made.

After being stopped by Texas state troopers for making a left turn without signaling, the assailant shot at the officers and then drove toward Midland. He subsequently abandoned his car and hijacked a postal van. The gunman continued shooting indiscriminately as he went. He was eventually killed in a shootout with police at an Odessa theater parking lot.
incidents.weapon: AR-type rifle
incidents.notes: Obtained AR-style rifle from a private seller in Lubbock, Tex., despite failing a background check in 2014 for a mental health issue.

incidents.narrative: Four men were killed and six others were wounded in southeast Fresno when gunmen broke into a backyard party and opened fire on dozens of people watching football. On December 31, 20119, six suspected gang members who, according to police, had mistakenly believed it was a rival gang’s party and attacked to avenge a murder from earlier that day.
incidents.weapon: Gun

incidents.narrative: Eight family members, seven of them adults, were beaten to death in a mobile home. A child was injured. Guy Heinze Jr., who reported the slayings to police, was found guilty of eight counts of murder and sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Blunt-force object, probably stock of shotgun

incidents.narrative: Police arrived at a shooting to find a 4-year-old girl who had covered her bullet wounds with Band-Aids telling them "My whole family is dead." Richard Terrance Ringold pleaded guilty to four counts of murder, and is serving life in prison.
incidents.weapon: 9mm handgun - Police said they recovered 9 mm bullets from all the victims.

incidents.narrative: Trevor Branscum, 38, had been drinking and argued with his wife at a market. Later that night, with his blood-alcohol level four times the legal limit for driving, he shot their four children with a rifle before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: hunting rifle

incidents.narrative:
A 14-year-old who called 911 about hearing gunshots. Deputies responding to the home in Elkmont, AL found one adult and two minors dead at the scene. Another adult and minor were hospitalized with critical injuries and later died.
 The teenager then admitted to killing five members of his family: his father, stepmother and siblings.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm firearm
incidents.notes: First names of juveniles not yet released.

incidents.narrative: An immigrant from El Salvador shot and killed a woman and three children in their home and then committed suicide. The woman also was from El Salvador and they lived together as a family.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber rifle (according to a Spanish-language site - elsalvador.com

incidents.narrative: Jones killed his wife (allegedly during an argument) and the four children on what is believed to be July 10, 2019. Then on September 15, 2019, after crashing his van in Brantley County, GA, he told responding officers that his dead wife was in the back of the vehicle. He then told police about their children whose bodies were left in wooded area in Charlton County, GA, off Hwy. 301. All five victims (wife, 2 stepsons, and 2 daughters) were apparently killed weeks earlier in the family residence. T
incidents.weapon: Jones killed his wife with a baseball bat
incidents.notes: The ex-wife of Michael Jones was told by Jones that he and his current wife, Casei, were getting a divorce and asked to stay at her home in Jacksonville.

incidents.narrative: Involved in a bitter divorce, a man shot his wife and four children before turning the gun on himself. All but one of the children died. About two weeks before the shooting rampage, the assailant sent his estranged wife a photo of a handgun with the message “It’s sure happening.”
incidents.weapon: Handgun

incidents.narrative: John David Young, 38, shot and killed his wife, mother-in-law and two children in the middle of the night, and then killed himself. Deputies were alerted by the mother-in-law, who called police to report "He's killing us."
incidents.weapon: Ruger 9mm semiautomatic handgun - "high capacity" clip (City Marshal Rowan Zachry)

incidents.narrative: A retiree shot and killed his wife, daughter, son and mother-in-law before committing suicide as they gathered for Labor Day dinner. The killing was precipitated by a "fierce argument" with his wife, police said.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun

incidents.narrative: Isaac Zamora stole two guns and killed six people, including a sheriff's deputy. Zamora, was sentenced to life in a state mental hospital but returned to prison after doctors said he posed too much of a threat. The state paid victims' families $9 million.
incidents.weapon: Lever-action Winchester rifle, a handgun, knife

incidents.narrative: Investigators found the bodies of a woman, her two children and her cousin. Her ex-husband Jae Hwan Shim led authorities to a fifth body in Mexico in late 2013. Shim and his friend Tae Won Kwon have pleaded guilty. Both will serve life in prison.
An employee, upset after his supervisor reprimanded him, shot the man and five co-workers at the Atlantis Plastics plant. All but one died. The killer committed suicide at the scene.
incidents.weapon: Hi-Point 45 ACP .45-caliber pistol

incidents.narrative: Lively James Stratton, 22, was arrested and charged with four counts of murder for the fatal shooting of his four roommates inside  a duplex in the 4100 block of Highland Avenue. Initially, no motive has been identified other than reports that Stratton may have shot and killed the four men over an altercation that occurred earlier that day.
A 28-year-old Maurice Lewis was arrested and faces murder charges after confessing to killing his mother, stepfather and two younger half-brothers inside their home.

Officials believe the shooting began when the detective approached one of the gunmen at a nearby cemetery in connection with a homicide investigation and was shot dead. 
The gunmen then fled in a stolen rental truck and eventually ended up at a nearby kosher market, where they opened fire on police officers and civilians. Three of the civilians were killed. Subsequent reports suggest it may have been inspired by antisemitism.
incidents.weapon: David Anderson used an AR-15-like rifle, while Francine Graham, had a Mossberg 12-gauge shotgun, according to New Jersey Attorney General Gurbir Grewal. Hundreds of shell casings were recovered from the scene, according to Grewal, as well as a 9mm Ruger and 9mm Glock 17. Also found were a .22-caliber Mark-IV with a silencer and a homemade device to catch shell casings.

incidents.narrative: A robbery ended with the two suspects shooting and killing four people, then setting the house ablaze in an attempt to cover it up. Rolando Terrell was sentenced to life in prison. Lester Hayes worked out a plea deal and got a 20-year sentence.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm semi-automatic handgun - "In his testimony at trial, Lester Hayes described how Rolando Terrell brought a 9-mm handgun and a bottle of Corona full of gasoline to a robbery, then used the gun to fatally shoot four people inside a home and the beer bottle to set the home on fire." (Star-Ledger - April 8, 2011)

incidents.narrative: Officers responded shortly after 9 p.m. to a call of shots fired at 1028 Lura Place SW. Three people were found dead, a fourth died at the hospital. Two others suffered injuries that were not life-threatening. The victims were all related. Although unsolved, initial interviews revealed that an unknown vehicle drove down Lura Place “and fired multiple shots at the male in the roadway.” Daniel Baca may have been the primary target on a shooting that also claimed his mother Christine Baca, his grandmother Manuelita Sotelo, and his cousin Vitoria Cereceres.
incidents.weapon: Gun, unknown type

incidents.narrative: Responding to complaints of an odor coming from an abandoned home, the police discovered the bodies of four gunshot victims. Because of the extent of decomposition, the date of death could not be determine. Two of the four victims have been identified. The location was known as a drug house.
incidents.weapon: Unidentified gun

incidents.narrative: Thomas Mortimer IV admitted killing his wife, two young children and mother-in-law and was sentenced to four life terms without parole. According to a letter Mortimer wrote that was found at the scene, he hated his wife's parents, with whom he lived.
incidents.weapon: Knife

incidents.narrative: Police found three people bleeding from lethal stab wounds, and a body in the basement. Michael Eric Ballard, who had served time for killing a man in 1991, has been sentenced to death. In 2015, Gov. Tom Wolf declared a moratorium on the death penalty.
incidents.weapon: Knife

incidents.narrative: A gathering of acquaintances at a North Hollywood café ended when a man left and returned with a handgun, firing 50 bullets, killing four and injuring two. Nerses A. Galstyan was charged with four counts of murder and received a life sentence.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun - Court docs: "The defendant then left the room and exited the restaurant. He returned several minutes later armed with a 9 millimeter handgun and multiple loaded magazines. Upon re-entering the banquet room, he immediately began firing at the group of people inside. In total, the defendant discharged fifty rounds from a single handgun. Four of the victims were killed. Two others received serious injuries."

incidents.narrative: Brooke Phillips, featured in HBO's reality series "Cathouse," was one of four killed in a drug dispute.  Phillips and Barrera were both pregnant (which explains why some reports note 6 killed). In exchange for a life sentence,  David Allen Tyner and Johnathan Cochran pleaded guilty and agreed to testify against Denny Phillips and Russell Hogshooter. Denny E. Phillips and Russell Hogshooter were convicted at trial and received life sentences.
incidents.weapon: Police: Shell casings from two different handguns, along with several knives, ammunition - Probable Cause Affidavit confirms "handgun" aspect

incidents.narrative: Wearing a bulletproof vest, Jiverly Wong, 41, entered a citizenship class and fired 98 shots from two handguns. Wong killed 13 people and injured several more before shooting himself.
incidents.weapon: Beretta .45 ACP Pistol, Model BER Px4 Storm, Serial # PK07133 (11 shots fired and purchased about 03/21/2009) and a Beretta 9mm Model 92FS  Serial # Ber430241 (87 shots fired and purchased 03/21/2009).   Weapon info from Court docs and Police Incident Reports etc… Also found with Wong was a "large buck knife with sheath", two 9mm magazines and one .45-caliber magazine.

incidents.narrative: A week after losing his medical job, Ervin Antonio Lupoe, 40, killed his wife and their five children in their home located in the Wilmington neighborhood of LA city. He then committed suicide. In a note, Lupoe wrote that he and his wife, who also lost her job, had agreed to the killings.
incidents.weapon: Revolver

incidents.narrative: An 18-year-old, after an earlier disagreement with his father about coming home late, went to his brother's closet looking for clothes and found his brother's 12-gauge shotgun. He proceeded to shoot and kill his stepmother, stepsister, brother and father. In his confession to police he said 'I don’t know why I killed my family today.' He had experienced some personal problems prior to the killings, including moving back into his parents' house after breaking up with his live-in girlfriend and not getting into the Marines. Sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge shotgun (brother's hunting gun found in closet in family's home)

incidents.narrative: Investigators at first thought four children and their mother had died in an accidental house fire. But they discovered the kids had been killed -- three had slashed throats -- and Leisa Jones, 30, died of smoke inhalation.
incidents.weapon: Straight razor, fire

incidents.narrative: Aaron Huff, 28, attended a Seattle rave and an after-party at a house, then left. He returned with a handgun and a shotgun that he used to kill six people before killing himself. He left an assault rifle in his car.
incidents.weapon: Winchester Defender pump action 12-gauge shotgun with pistol grip, Ruger semi-automatic P-94 handgun .40 caliber, Bushmaster AR-15 assault rifle in vehicle (not used), two bandoliers with 15 rounds of 12-gauge 00 buck shotgun shells each, 2 extra .40-caliber magazines on his belt.  He also wore a tactical ammunition pouch filled with AR-15 ammunition for the Bushmaster in his truck.  The murder weapons had been confiscated by Montana police 6 years earlier after he shot at a statue of a moose, but were later returned to the suspect.

incidents.narrative: A 27-year-old man entered a Northern Illinois University lecture hall during a class, shot and killed five people and wounded 21 before committing suicide. He was a former student at the university and had a history of mental illness.
incidents.weapon:
(From school report; more details in report): Steven Kazmierczak had the following weapons, all 4 purchased from Tony’s Gun & Ammo, 2311 Roland Drive, Champaign, IL.



1. Sig Sauer – 9mm short Kurz pistol with serial number S251262, Model P232

He purchased August 3, 2007 for an estimated $600

2. HiPoint – 380 caliber Model CF380, with serial number P877636

He purchased December 27, 2007 for an estimated $250.

3. Glock 19 – 9mm pistol with serial number LTG682

He purchased February 6, 2008 for $456.95. He picked this weapon up on February 9, 2008.

4. Remington – 12 gauge shotgun, Sportsman 48, with serial number 3009849

He purchased it on February 6, 2008 for $268.21 and picked it up on February 9, 2008.

5. Black lock-blade knife and a small canister of pepper spray

The date-of-purchase information is unknown.



Steven Kazmierczak also purchased three (3) additional firearms from Moser Guns,

located at 9445 Keslinger Road in DeKalb, IL. The dates of those purchases were

February 19, 2007, March 23, 2007 and March 26, 2007.



On August 4, 2007, Kazmierczak purchased a Baikal 12 gauge shotgun, Model IZH

18EM-M, serial number 057714B, from Tony’s Gun & Ammo, located at 2311 Roland

Drive in Champaign, IL. DeKalb Police Department detectives recovered this weapon

at Kazmierczak’s apartment, located at 2108 West White Street, Apartment 137 W, in

Champaign, IL, after the shooting.



Kazmierczak ordered ammunition and magazine pouches from various sources. On

February 4, 2008 he ordered 2 Bianchi Model 20W Tactical Magazine Pouches, Model

15972, for $44.91 each and 2 Glock MF19015 9mm 15-round magazines, for $17.41

each. He ordered them from Able Ammo via its website of www.ableammo.com. They

were shipped to his home address.



On February 4, 2008, he ordered a right-hand Glock holster (BH CRBN FBR GLK 19-

23-32 RH TXTRD) for $34.95 and 2 black Glock Factory Magazines (Glock 17-34, 9mm

blue, 33-round capacities) for $29.86 each. He ordered them from TGSOM, Inc. 1449

S. Broadway Street, Green Bay, WI 54304 via their website of www.topglock.com. They

were shipped to his home address.

incidents.narrative: Charles Roberts IV, 32, entered a schoolhouse in an Amish hamlet, dismissed the boys and bound the girls. He carried three guns, a stun gun, two knives, a hammer, 600 rounds. He shot 10, five fatally, before killing himself as police closed in.
incidents.weapon:
Springfield XD-9, 9mm Semi-Automatic Pistol, with 10 round magazine, 12 Gauge Browning Shotgun, Ruger M-77 Mark II,  30.06 Springfield Rifle with a Bushnell Scope, 600 rounds, stun gun, two knives and a hammer.    



“Mr. Roberts used the 12 gauge shotgun to fire 3 rounds at the children (and 1 additional round at the police outside the school) - Mr. Roberts used the Springfield 9mm to fire 10 rounds at the children (then reloaded the weapon and subsequently used it to commit suicide – 1 round) - The Ruger M-77 Rifle was brought to the scene; however it was never taken out of its case and was not used during the commission of this crime - Mr. Roberts shot a total of 15 rounds (11 handgun and 4 shotgun).  The rifle was never used.”

(Capt. William P. White, PA State Police Commander, Troop J, Lancaster)

incidents.narrative: James E. Holmes opened fire in an Aurora, Colo., movie theater, killing 12 and injuring 70. Holmes, who had pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity, was found guilty of first degree murder. He was sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: All legally purchased: Smith & Wesson M&P15 .22-caliber rifle (AR-15 style); Remington 870 pump-action Express Tactical shotgun, .40-caliber Glock handgun, tear gas. (Another Glock found in suspect's car. Over eight weeks he bought 3,000 rounds for semiautomatic rifle, 3,000 for the two Glocks and 300 cartridges for shotgun. Suspect was dressed in ballistic helmet, vest, leggings, throat and groin protector and gas mask.

incidents.narrative: Eduardo Sencion entered an IHOP and fired about 60 rounds from an AK-47, killing three off-duty uniformed National Guard members and another patron. Seven others, including two National Guard members, were injured. Sencion shot himself in the head.
incidents.weapon: Norinco Arms Mak 90 FULLY Automatic Assault rifle (Illegally modified/altered AK-47 style –Chinese manufacture/banned weapon).  Found in gunman’s vehicle were a Colt .38 revolver, which he used to kill himself, and a Romarm Cugir AK-47 (NBC News is source for weapons). Also found was a Glock 26 (see notes) and 15 extra 30-round magazines.

incidents.narrative: Banita Jacks killed her four daughters by stabbing, beating and strangling them. She lived with their bodies for several months. She was convicted of murder and sentenced to 120 years in jail.
A 24-year-old homeless man apparently bludgeoned five other homeless men, 4 fatally, with a metal bar in the Chinatown section of Manhattan.
incidents.weapon: A metal object, possibly a pipe.

incidents.narrative:
Nine people were shot, four fatally, at a private bar (the Tequila KC Bar)  in Kansas City. The incident appears to have been precipitated  by the bartender's refusal to serve one of the two assailants.

Police said that the shooting may have been motivated by an earlier dispute at the bar, and that Villanueva-Morales and Javier Alatorre allegedly returned afterward and carried out the shooting.
incidents.weapon: Handgun

incidents.narrative: Just after Omar S. Thornton was forced to resign from his beer delivery job, he opened fire with a 9 mm pistol, killing eight co-workers and injuring two before killing himself. Supervisors had confronted Thornton over pilferage.
incidents.weapon: (2) 9mm semiautomatic handguns (Ruger SR9 9mm/17 round capacity and Ruger P95 9mm/15 round capacity)

incidents.narrative: Police found the bodies of two women and two children in a trash-filled garage apartment. Maryland has banned capital punishment, so Darrell Lynn Bellard will serve life in prison. Tkeisha Nicole Gilmer pleaded guilty in 2011 and was sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: 2 "handguns"  - according to the suspects statements - Washington Post - 09/04/2010

incidents.narrative: Three neighbors who tried to intervene in a domestic dispute were killed after a gunman shot a woman inside an apartment. Dennis Clark III, the woman's live-in boyfriend, was killed by police in the complex's parking lot.
incidents.weapon: Weapon: a pistol-grip Mossberg 500 pump shotgun with a four-round saddle (murder weapon) and a .40-caliber Taurus semi-automatic pistol

incidents.narrative: Nathan Fortner's ex-girlfriend and two of her relatives were shot dead at their home. The body of a fourth victim was found in an abandoned house where the ex-girlfriend said Fortner had sexually assaulted her just days before. Fortner committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: Revolver stolen from the home of a relative of the suspect on or about the day of the murders.

incidents.narrative: Vonzell Roundtree, high on drugs, saw two men argue with his uncle in a Southwest Philadelphia bar. When he stopped firing his handgun, all three were dead. A fourth man died of his wounds a month later. Roundtree is serving four life prison terms.
incidents.weapon: 9mm Beretta semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A family member found a couple and their three girls shot dead inside their home. The Culpeper County sheriff said the deaths were apparently a murder-suicide resulting from a "domestic situation" between the two adults.
incidents.weapon: .380 high point semi-automatic handgun - confimed by Culpeper County Sheriff's Office PIO, Detective Deavers

incidents.narrative: Bigamist Christopher M. Henderson and wife Rhonda Carlson are charged with murder in the deaths of another wife, her mother and two children. The victims' bodies were found in their burning house. The woman had recently filed for a protective order.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber rifle, knife or sharp object, fire

incidents.narrative: A fire destroyed a rural home, revealing the bodies of a family of six inside. Autopsies led authorities to conclude that Scott Westerhuis had shot and killed his wife and four school-age children and then set fire to their home before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: Charles Daly Field Model .12-gauge pump shotgun

incidents.narrative: Christopher Harper-Mercer, 26, opened fire on his writing class at Umqua Community College in rural Oregon, killing his instructor and eight other people before he was wounded by police. He committed suicide at the scene.
incidents.weapon: Handgun used in classroom but law enforcement has not yet identified the murder weapon(s) specifically used.  The following weapons have been identified, but it is unclear if these were part of the 6 weapons found with the shooter, or if they are from the weapons cache found at his apartment.  Semi-automatic handgun, .40-caliber Taurus semi-automatic handgun, .556-caliber Del-Ton semi-automatic rifle (AR-15 look) (s).40-caliber Smith & Wesson

incidents.narrative: The bodies of 40-year-old Deirdre Zaccardi, 11-year-old Alexis Zaccardi, 9-year-old twins Nathaniel and Kathryn Zaccardi, and 43-year-old Joseph Zaccardi were found by a relative inside their townhouse. All five appeared to have been shot. It has been determined that Joseph Zaccardi, killed his wife and children before killing himself.
incidents.notes: The Medical Examiner confirmed this to be a murder-suicide.

incidents.narrative: Ricardo M. McCray was sentenced to life without parole in a shooting outside a popular downtown bar. Four people, including a man celebrating his wedding anniversary, died. Four others were injured, one so seriously that he remains hospitalized.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun - Ballistics evidence showed all the victims were killed with the same 9 mm handgun. A witness testified he threw the gun off a bridge at the instruction of a friend of McCray's who drove him from the restaurant.

incidents.narrative: Eight family members were shot execution style at four separate locations near their homes in rural Ohio. A newborn, a six-month-old and a three-year-old were discovered unharmed. The case Involved custody  battle over Sophia Wagner, 3 at time of murder, daughter Hanna Rhodes and Edward “Jake” Wagner.
incidents.weapon: Multiple handguns and a homemade silencer

incidents.narrative: Offender lived in a group home for the mentally ill and got into a fight with either his roommate or landlord, and set the fire in his room as revenge. Five men who also lived in the home died. Offender is incompetent to stand trial and will be sent to psychiatric care. Victims were so badly burned they are unidentifiable

Esteban Santiago-Ruiz was born in NJ but grew up in Puerto Rico; after serving in the National Guard and Iraq, family members said he was a changed person, extremely quiet, withdrawn, and with anger and mental health issues. He moved to Alaska and dated a woman 14 years his senior, having a baby with her, but was arrested for domestic violence against her, after which they continued to live together. He was fired from the Alaska National Guard for poor performance and worked at a security company before being fired for mental health issues. A few months prior to the incident he went to the FBI claiming that the government was trying to control his mind and make him join ISIS; he was given a mental health evaluation. His guns had been taken away a few times previously, but he was currently a legal gun owner and concealed carry permit owner.

Neal was suspected to be mentally ill, had just assaulted a neighbor, and was called about DV the day prior to the incident. He shot and killed his wife before going on a rampage to kill his two neighbors, whom he suspected of cooking meth, and then stole their truck to go to the elementary school that his neighbor's son attended. He was prohibited from having guns because of the restraining order, but illegally manufactured the ghost guns at home.

Nikolas Cruz had a history of serious mental health and behavioral problems, switching schools multiple times for disciplinary reasons, etc. He attended specialty schools for students with emotional and behavioral problems, and had been recommended to be involuntarily committed by a SRO and counselors. After being expelled from Majory Stoneman Douglas High School, he used an AR-15 style rifle that he had legally purchased to kill students and teachers. He had a history of making threats about killing others, specifically referencing wanting to become a school shooter, and he had been reported to local authorities including the FBI on multiple occassions for these remarks on social media.
incidents.weapon: AR-15 style semi-automatic rifle(Smith & Wesson M&P15 Sport 2)

incidents.narrative: Brian Diez, 26, barged into his ex-girlfriend's house, shot dead five adults and took his two young children. He brought the kids to a relative in California before committing suicide. His ex, who was killed, had a restraining order against Diez.
incidents.weapon: Glock .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun – from Incident Report (FOIA’d)

incidents.narrative: The bodies of a mother and her three daughters were found in the embers of their home. Corey King, a friend of the woman's son, was found guilty of four counts of first-degree murder and has been sentenced to death.

One morning, four years after his fifth divorce, Carey Hal Dyess, 73, drove around Yuma County, shooting six people, five of them fatally: his latest ex-wife, three of her friends and her divorce lawyer. He then pulled over and killed himself.
incidents.weapon: Smith and Wesson .38 special revolver-killed himself and the rest of the deceased the victims, Walther P-22 .22 caliber semi-auto pistol-used at the first scene, victim survived, Remington Wingmaster 870 12 gauge shotgun-unused but recovered from inside the vehicle

incidents.narrative: Three teenagers and a 25-year-old man were found shot along the same block, with the three teens inside a crashed car. Some evidence suggests that two of the teens may have been involved in an aborted robbery plot, but details remain unclear. The suspect knew the victims, but the relationship is unknown. Larin Garcia was found hiding under a pickup truck a few blocks away; he was taken for medical attention, and left without the police/staff knowing. He went to a friend, telling him that he had been involved in a traffic accident, and the friend loaned him money and clothing. Larin-Garcia was then arrested at a Greyhound bus station.  Larin-Garcia appeared to be drunk when police found him, and kept giving them incorrect DOB and name information. After being arrested, undercover agents were in a cell with him, and he said that he was "screwed"

Policed responded to a 911 call in Lafayette, WI, finding two dead (Lailie Vang and the suspected assailant Ritchie German, Jr.) and two injured (Ms. Vang’s parents). The police subsequently went to the home of the suspected assailant, finding three dead victims (the suspected assailant’s mother, brother, and nephew). 
Authorities speculate that The assailant may have been imitating the October 2018 abduction of teenager Jayme Closs less than an hour away.
incidents.weapon: Gun

incidents.narrative: Police tailing suspects in a series of drug-related robberies found four men bound and shot in a garage after the suspects left. Police killed Arturo Ibarra after a chase. Raul Segura-Rodriguez faces four counts of murder and charges from other killings.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic casings recovered at the crime scene. Actual murder weapon(s) never recovered.  (Chicago PD PIO)  - Prosecutors stated that the suspects arrived carrying two handguns but Hannan will only count 1 since there’s no way to tell if both were fired.

incidents.narrative: Late on a Saturday night, neighbors heard pounding on a door, then the sound of someone breaking in, then gunshots. Police found the bodies of a woman, her two young sons and her boyfriend.
A man diagnosed with bipolar disorder and schizophrenia shot his parents, brother and 17-year-old niece at the family's longtime home. He killed himself before police arrived.

When Stanley Neace's wife didn't cook his eggs the way he wanted, he became enraged and fatally shot her and her daughter, and then went to other trailer homes and shot three neighbors. Neace, 47, killed himself with a shotgun.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge pump-action shotgun

incidents.narrative: Lee Roy Williams told police in a recorded interview that he ''snapped'' after learning his roommates planned to evict him. He pleaded guilty to four counts of murder in the slayings of two men and two women and received four consecutive life sentences.
incidents.weapon: .380 pistol, baseball bat and knife

incidents.narrative: Several hours after arguing with a man at a nightclub, Zachary Q. Meeks set the man's house on fire. Five kids -- ages 5 months to 10 years -- died. Meeks pleaded guilty. Sentence: Five consecutive life terms without possibility of parole.

Angry over the recent number of police shootings of unarmed black men, Micah Xavier Johnson targeted white police officers during a public protest in Dallas. Johnson later fled to El Centro College, where he was killed by police using a bomb disposal robot.

An $1,800 robbery ended in the shootings of five people, four fatally, in a home invasion in the Mattapan neighborhood. Dwayne Moore received a sentence of life in prison without parole. Kimani Washington struck a deal and got 16 to 18 years in prison.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber Iberia handgun (recovered and matched) and shells consistent with those of a 9mm semi-automatic Cobray, which resembles a submachine gun, were found at the scene.  This weapon was also used in the killings but never recovered.

incidents.narrative: Mark Short killed his wife, three children, and the family dog before committing suicide.

On January 12, 2010, three people were killed and two others critically injured in a workplace shooting at a truck rental business located near Kennesaw, GA.  Another victim died in 2013 from complications related to his injuries. The shooter, a former employee Jesse J. Warren, was found incompetent to stand trial in 2017.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun

incidents.narrative: A romantic dispute led Marcos Chavez Gonzalez to kill his girlfriend's adult relatives and  friends with a high-powered assault rifle. Gonzalez pleaded guilty and was sentenced to three life terms.
incidents.weapon: SKS AK-47 semiautomatic rifle - gun never recovered but shell casings were - 7.62x39mm - 19 casings found

incidents.narrative: Five relatives found dead after a house fire had been shot, the coroner found. A sixth, Russell Wilcox, died of smoke inhalation. Wilcox was mentally disabled. Investigators believe he killed his family members.
incidents.weapon: .222-cal rifle and 16-gauge shotgun

incidents.narrative: Returning after having bought marijuana, Parks and an accomplice, both armed, ordered everyone in the home to take off their clothes and hand over cellphones, money and jewelry, prosecutors said.  They then discovered a woman in a back bedroom with a cellphone and became "agitated," they said. The two "started executing the victims by shooting them in the head as they were lying on the ground," according to a court document detailing the charges. Four victims died at the scene. There were two survivors of the shooting. One escaped by playing dead and was able to later identify Parks. The other, Shacora's teenage daughters, remained on life support, unable to respond to touch or sound, until she died more than 10 months later.

Five adults were found dead in two trailers that had been burglarized, one was set on fire. Samuel Lee Conway was convicted in 2011, but the conviction was later overturned. In a 2016 retrial, he plead guilty to lesser charges and received a 40 year sentence for each of five murders to run concurrently.  Jeremy Pickney received 50 years for burglary charges. Marvin Stringer was killed by police.
incidents.weapon: At least 4 handguns: .22, .25, .45 and 9mm .38-class

incidents.narrative: A nurse and her three children -- ages 4, 6 and 9 -- were reported missing after the mom didn't show up for work. Their bodies were found in their home. David Cornell Bennett, Jr., a former boyfriend, plead guilty and was sentenced to life without parole.
Spencer Hight went to his ex-wife's football party and shot her and 7 of their friends. Hight was fatality shot at the scene by the police.
An unnamed 9-year-old was arrested for intentionally setting fire to a mobile home, killing five members of his family, including three children.
incidents.weapon: Fire

incidents.narrative: Maron Thomas spent several months at a state mental hospital after his family was found slain in their home. His 2-year-old niece had been decapitated. Thomas was later tried and convicted of murder . He was sentenced to life without parole eligibility.
incidents.weapon: Shotgun and handgun and machete - "Near Cedric Thomas' body, investigators found a shotgun and handgun, both believed to have been used in the crime, he said." (The Houston Chronicle, January 21, 2010)

incidents.narrative: James Kraig Kahler lost his high-paying job after his domestic-assault arrest. His wife of 23 years said he was controlling. He was convicted of killing his wife, two daughters and wife's grandmother, and sentenced to death. His son, 10, was uninjured.
incidents.weapon: Not recovered, shells from .223-cal AK-47-style assault rifle

incidents.narrative: Maurice Clemmons used a handgun to kill four Lakeview, Wash., police officers as they worked on laptops at a Parkland coffee shop. He was killed two days later by a Seattle officer at a traffic stop. Several people were convicted of aiding his flight.
incidents.weapon: 9-mm Glock Model 17 reported stolen March 2006 from car; .38-caliber revolver Smith & Wesson no sale records after shipment to Lakewood, CO, gun store.

incidents.narrative: Four young men were shot multiple times each in a first floor apartment of a Reading rowhouse. No suspects have been charged, but the DA indicated that several may be charged soon, and that the suspects were involved in a major drug bust.

Two mental health evaluators found Christopher Brian Speight insane when he killed eight relatives and friends. Speight pleaded guilty to three counts of capital murder and received five life terms in prison. Police found multiple bombs at his home.
incidents.weapon: High-powered rifle, rigged house with at least seven explosive devices, gun collector, took NRA gun course (at Liberty University, 2003), had concealed weapon permit

incidents.narrative: It remains unclear as to why Dimitrios committed the Santa Fe High School Shooting. While some emphasized that he was heavily bullied, was a loner, wore trenchcoats and boots, and displayed an avid interest in violent videogames and guns, others stated that he did have friends, was quiet, had no mental health problems or a criminal history, and displayed zero interest in the recent Parkland school shooting.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge Remington shotgun; Rossi.38-caliber snub-nosed revolver; Explosives; Molotov cocktail

incidents.narrative: Damian Jordan had a history of violence against women, with multiple arrests for battery. He pleaded guilty to four counts of manslaughter in the shootings of two sisters and their children. Jordan was sentenced to 80 years in prison.
incidents.weapon: "Semi-automatic pistol"  - "Deputy Superintendent Marlon Defillo said ballistics tests already confirm that the semi-automatic pistol found in Jordan’s possession was the gun was used in the massacre. Now detectives want to find a definitive DNA link between the gun and Jordan. “The ballistics match on the gun, but I have to put the gun in his hand,” Defillo said. “The witnesses are all dead, so we’re going to have to win this case on forensics.” (WWL-TV Channel 4 - March 29, 2010)

incidents.narrative: A toilet paper roll drenched in paint thinner, set ablaze and thrown at the bottom of a crowded Brooklyn tenement's stairs trapped five victims. Daniel Ignacio received 25 years to life in prison. Officers testified that Ignacio told them he was drunk.
Using a stolen Springfield XD 9mm semiautomatic handgun, Chi Dinh Ta killed his wife's relatives who she had recently arranged to have immigrate from Vietnam.
incidents.weapon: Handgun

incidents.narrative: Seven people were shot, four fatally, and two others were injured while fleeing during an early morning assault inside a private club that features illegal gambling. At least fifteen rounds were fired in the mayhem, police said. Two guns, a 9mm handgun and a revolver, were found at the scene. It was unclear whether the shooter — who had been gambling for about an hour before the fatal shootout — was upset over losing money or had come to the club to steal cash, sources said.

After leading police on a daylong manhunt, Davon Crawford, 33, shot himself as officers found him inside a West Side home. The night before, Crawford had killed his wife, sister-in-law and three nephews and nieces. He injured his 7-year-old daughter.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A rookie volunteer firefighter was found guilty of setting a fire that killed a mother and her three children. Prosecutors said Caleb Lacey drove to the fire station and donned gear, wanting to be a hero. He was sentenced to 25 years to life.
incidents.weapon: Arson by volunteer firefighter

incidents.narrative: Upset over his finances -- he had lost his job and lost money in the stock market -- Karthik Rajaram, 45, shot and killed his wife, mother-in-law and three sons, ages 7 to 19, in their home in the upscale Sorrento neighborhood. Rajaram committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - bought September 16, 2008

incidents.narrative: A man bound and fatally shot six members of a family in their home. A seventh, wounded, played dead and then alerted police, who arrested Ronald Haskell, 33, in a nearby neighborhood after a four-hour standoff. Tried for murder in 2019, Haskell was sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: Springfield XD 9mm semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Four people were found shot to death in Charlotte's Tree Top apartment complex. The murders remain unsolved.

A 66-year-old truck driver, who had lived in the building for about 15 years, walked into a neighbor's apartment where he fatally shot three men and a woman as they ate dinner. He then went upstairs to the third floor, entered another apartment and shot a woman there. That woman was taken to the hospital in critical condition where she died. 

The assailant was facing eviction for non-payment of condo fees as well as foreclosure on his mortgage. He had filed for bankruptcy in September 2017 in which he reported owing $24,000 to the Internal Revenue Service and more than $60,000 to creditors. 

The assailant left two notes written in polish behind in his apartment reflecting his determination to carry out the murders.
incidents.weapon: 40-caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: Chiew Chan Saevang, 38, and his girlfriend, Yer Yang, 40, decided to steal a drug shipment from their partner in an opium ring. At his home, they killed the partner's wife and three children. The pair died a week later in Utah while fleeing police.
incidents.weapon: Ozark Trail Knife, Browning 9mm semiautomatic handgun (victims) and Hi-Point 9mm semiautomatic handgun on himself and girlfriend/suspect #2. (Capt. Joel Fish, PIO, Catawba County Sheriff’s Office)

incidents.narrative: Five teens were shot to death while sitting in a car. The suspect maintained his innocence and plead guilty to lesser crimes after his case was overturned. Now prosecutors have a new suspect.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun – 32 round magazine – 27 shots fired (27 Aquila .40-caliber S&W shell casings found at scene)

incidents.narrative: In retaliation for the murder of a friend, two gunmen opened fire at a backyard party killing five and wounding three. Police have determined the suspect with a handgun shot in a manner that forced party-goers towards a gap in a fence where a suspect with an AK-47 rifle waited.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber semi-automatic handgun and an AK-47 rifle.

incidents.narrative: Pedro Alberto Vargas, 42, set a fire in his apartment and shot the building managers who came to see what was wrong. He then shot a man on the street and a family of three before taking two tenants hostage. After negotiations failed, police killed him.
incidents.weapon: Glock 9 mm semiautomatic, purchased legally. Suspect had a valid concealed carry permit.

incidents.narrative: Steven Sueppel, 42, beat to death his wife and four children before killing himself. Sueppel had been indicted a month earlier on charges that he had stolen more than a half million dollars from the bank where he worked.
incidents.weapon: Two baseball bats

incidents.narrative: Joshua S. Durcho's girlfriend had threatened to call police on him, so he strangled her, and then strangled her four young children. Durcho, who had been in prison and vowed not to return, pleaded guilty and received five life sentences without parole.
incidents.weapon: Strangulation by hands, cords

incidents.narrative: A husband went to his in-laws' house, where his estranged wife was living, and shot and killed his mother-in-law, son and two stepsons. He shot and beat his wife, who survived. Roberto A. Rojas was sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Llama Max 1 .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun (Serial #71-04-09810-03) and Remington "Sears Ted Williams Model 3T" .22-caliber rifle(Serial #58822). (info from ATF Firearns Trace)

incidents.narrative: Five men entered a bar, intending robbery. They shot three and in the melee a fourth man also was shot. Pedro Duran, 32, Renil Escobar, 29, Mario A. Funes, 26, Rigoberto Funes, 20 and Jose A. Cornejo, 22, got life in prison.
incidents.weapon: .357 Magnum revolver (drawn and used to hold owner/patrons at gunpoint, but not fired), a Llama .380-caliber semiautomatic handgun and a .22-caliber -caliber semiautomatic handgun . Court docs

incidents.narrative: Lee Isaac Bedwell Leeds, who had been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia, thought his father, two employees and a customer at his family's junkyard were plotting to kill him. Leeds was found competent to stand trial and was sentenced to 100 years in prison.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Jessie Dotson, out of prison five months for an earlier murder, was convicted of killing his brother and five others, including two toddlers. Dotson was sentenced to death. Three young children were badly injured. The older two testified against Dotson.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - semi-automatic handgun/knife/"board" – guns never found but 9mm and .380 shell casings and "jackets" found in the victims or at the crime scene, according to Tennessee Bureau of Investigation’s testimony. (Memphis Commercial Appeals Trial Blog).    http://blogs.commercialappeal.com/memphis_trial_blog/2010/10/tbi-firearms.html

incidents.narrative: A 14-year-old boy called police to say his father had shot him and his brother. Police found a woman and three children dead in the home; the teenager survived his injuries. Orland Cho, 41, husband and father of the three, later shot himself.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge shotgun (gauge confirmed by Records Supervisor Marsha Dell)

incidents.narrative: A 15-year-old used his father's handgun to kill his mother, father and two brothers while they were sleeping, then went to a friend's house to play video games. He had been arguing with his father. He was placed in a rehabilitation program.
incidents.weapon: Smith & Wesson Model 639 9mm semiautomatic handgun (fathers) (Balt. County Sheriff’s PIO)

incidents.narrative: A man angry at city officials entered a City Council meeting and began shooting, killing five, including two council members and two police officers. Months later, the mayor died of his injuries. Charles Lee "Cookie" Thornton, 52, was killed by police.
incidents.weapon: From Mark's summary: "Weapon(s): .44 Magnum revolver he brought to the scene and used to kill Officer William Biggs, and Officer Biggs’ .40 caliber handgun."

incidents.narrative: A 26-year-old man, upset over breaking up with his girlfriend, went to her mother's apartment and shot and killed four people. He later committed suicide when surrounded by police. Among those killed was his ex-girlfriend's boyfriend.
incidents.weapon: Colt Government .45-caliber handgun – stolen from an Alaskan military base in the 1960s and then from the killer’s father’s  safe.

incidents.narrative: A plan to steal marijuana and cash from a home ended in the shootings of two women, a baby and a toddler. Five men were convicted in connection to the robbery and slayings. The accused shooter, Ronald Davis, was sentenced to 245 years.
incidents.weapon: Handguns – TEC-9 handgun 9mm (Frazier) and a Glock .40 caliber (Davis) (Appeals-Court Doc)

incidents.narrative: Angry about two teenagers stealing his cellphone, a man set fire to their home. The blaze trapped two adults and four children, all younger than the age of 8. Michael A. Davis was sentenced to life without parole.

Michel Veillette, 34, hanged himself in jail while awaiting trial on charges that he stabbed his wife to death and then set fire to their house. The couple's four young children, all younger than 9, died from smoke inhalation.

A woman had twice asked the court to seize her ex-husband's long gun after she filed a protective order against him. David Peter Brockdorff, 40, used the .22-caliber rifle to shoot her and their three children before killing himself on Thanksgiving Day.
incidents.weapon: .22-cal rifle

incidents.narrative: A sheriff's deputy barged into his former girlfriend's locked apartment during a party and shot and killed six people. Two others were injured, including a police officer responding to the shooting. Tyler Peterson, 20, shot himself after a standoff.
incidents.weapon: Police-issued AR-15 assault rifle; Glock G22 .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun/suicide weapon

incidents.narrative: The case of Davontae Sanford, who at 14 confessed to killing four people and who  later recanted, has drawn national media attention. Sanford, who is developmentally disabled, remains in jail. Vincent Smothers, a contract killer, confessed in 2008.
incidents.weapon:
.45-caliber handgun and an AK-47



"In a written statement obtained last week by the Free Press, Smothers told police he and another man used a .45-caliber pistol and an AK47 assault rifle in the killings. Sanford told police that he used an M14 rifle to commit the crime, but forensics evidence shows that an AK47 and .45-caliber pistol were used.

incidents.narrative: A drug addict argued with a motel tenant and set fire to the motel, killing the man, his fiance and several other family members. Seven people were injured. Convicted of murder and arson, Sheree Dionne Murphy received five life sentences.

Ambrosio Analco had threatened to kill his estranged girlfriend, the mother of his children. He fatally shot three adults and a pair of 6-month-old twins. His 1-year-old daughter survived her injuries. Analco then shot himself in the chest twice.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - Colt MKJV Series 80 Government Model 380 Automatic Caliber, semi-automatic pistol.  Serial Number RR33240 (Wisconsin Crime Lab classification - from FOIA)

incidents.narrative: Wayne S. Powell, 41, made good on his threat, pouring gasoline inside a home's side door and lighting it. His ex-girlfriend, her mother, adopted son and a niece died. He was convicted and remains in prison under multiple death sentences.

A couple and their three teen-age daughters were shot with a .22-caliber rifle. Prosecutors said Shawn Bentler, 23, killed his family to gain control of his parents' estate. He is serving life in prison without possibility of parole.
incidents.weapon: Remington .22-caliber rifle - "Bentler struggled with his father and hit him with the butt of the Remington .22 caliber rifle forensically connected to the murders, shooting him in the leg and head before shooting the others." Fort Madison Daily Democrat - May 8, 2007

incidents.narrative: Said Biyad, 42, slit the throats of his four childen, who ranged in age from 2 to 8. He also beat his wife with a mallet, suspecting her of infidelity, prosecutors said. She survived. He was sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.

Angry over a fight, Valerie Moore set fire to a mattress outside a hotel room. The blaze spread through the Mizpah Hotel, killing 12 and injuring 30 others. Moore, who was convicted of second-degree murder in 1987, received 12 life sentences.

Michael Simmons has been confined indefinitely to a state mental hospital. The bodies of his wife and her four children were found by a woman visiting their home. Simmons previously had served time in prison for robbing and beating a disabled man.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - "The victims had been shot with a handgun sometime between 3 a.m. and 5:45 a.m., the affidavit said." (AP - 10/01/2006)

incidents.narrative: Four bodies -- three men and a woman -- were found in a Jeep in a Fresno residential neighborhood. They were bound with duct tape and cable ties. Police said they probably were involved in the illegal drug trade. The case remains unsolved.

Three brothers and a friend were gunned down on a porch in New Orleans. Two brothers were charged. One was tried but not convicted. The other, Raymond Amison, agreed to a 10-year sentence to avoid the possibility of the death penalty.
incidents.weapon: Police found casings and bullets from .45 and .40-caliber weapons at the scene and from the dead bodies, but no guns were recovered.

incidents.narrative: A woman, her fiance, her daughter, 16, and the fiance's nephew, 15, were gunned down over a drug debt. Frank Knight, 33, testified against James A. Bishop, 42, and Kelvin W. Kaigler, 28, who are serving life terms. Knight got 15 to 35 years in prison.
incidents.weapon: .38-caliber revolver

incidents.narrative: Arcan Cetin, an immigrant from Turkey, killed five at the Cascade Mall in Burlington, Washington. A year after being arrested, Cetin hanged himself in his cell.
Five victims were shot to death in police say was in connection with drug activity.

William Miller, 28, of Scottsdale, Ariz.,  was sentenced to death for murdering two former employees, Steven Duffy, 30, and Tammy Lovell, 32. They were working as police informants in an arson case against Miller, who also killed three of their relatives.
incidents.weapon: Taurus 9mm 6-shot Revolver and .22-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A 19-year-old with an extensive history of mental health troubles entered Westroads Mall and began firing an assault rifle. Eight people died and four were injured. Robert Hawkins, who declared that "I'll be famous,"  killed himself.
incidents.weapon: Century Arms Romanian WASR semi-automatic rifle (AK-47 type) and 30-round banana clip.

incidents.narrative: Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, an Army psychiatrist, has been sentenced to death in the Fort Hood shootings. He entered a military medical center firing a semi-automatic pistol, killing 13 and injuring 32. The FBI has called it a case of workplace violence.
incidents.weapon: FN Herstal 5.7 semi-automatic pistol, (so-called Cop Killer gun) and a .357 revolver(not fired according to investigators).

incidents.narrative: After smoking crack, Ronald Shrieves, 32, stabbed his parents and a niece and nephew in Modest Town, Va., in March 2006, prosecutors said. He pleaded guilty and was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.

At his Baton Rouge, La., church, Anthony Bell, 25, opened fire, killing four. He fled with his family at gunpoint. He killed his wife but released their three kids unharmed. His death sentence is on appeal.
incidents.weapon: .38-caliber revolver – handgun  ("The prosecutors said all six people were shot in the back of the head with a .38-caliber revolver. "It's a blessing to have one person survive," Brooks said. - The Advocate - Baton Rouge)

incidents.narrative: A woman driver was pursued by her ex-boyfriend and father of her child at speeds up to 120 mph. A crash killed her and four co-workers. Kevin Cales, 32, was convicted. He died in prison two years later from a punch by the woman's cousin, Waldemar Rivera.
incidents.weapon: Auto accident

incidents.narrative: A woman, 27, was shot in her home. Her three children -- ages 3, 5 and 10 -- were strangled or suffocated. A former boyfriend, named as a suspect by police, is in prison on a unrelated murder charge. He becomes eligible for parole in 2050.

Jesse Wise, 21, beat and strangled his grandmother, an uncle, two aunts and two cousins in Leola, Pa. Surviving relatives asked prosecutors not to seek the death penalty. Wise was sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Homemade iron bludgeon for those who died of blunt force

incidents.narrative: A mother, 19, her son, 2, her nephew, 17, and her father, 60, were found shot at their home outside Winchester, Va. Her former boyfriend, Jessi A. Jephson, 20, was found guilty and sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.
incidents.weapon: "handgun" - "……...spotted Jephson hiding near the railroad tracks, still with the semiautomatic pistol authorities believe he used in the killings, Eckman said."(Washington Post-Oct 7, 2006). Other accounts unverified have it as a .40-caliber pistol he was charged with Grand Larceny for stealing.

incidents.narrative: Desmond Turner, 28, and James Stewart, 30, were convicted of shooting seven family members in an attempted robbery and burglary at a home. Turner was sentenced to life in prison without parole, plus 88 years; Stewart, to 425 years.
incidents.weapon:
Evidence technicians recovered 23 discharged 7.62x39 mm cartridge casings from the scene. These cartridges accommodate high velocity caliber bullets used in AK-47 and SKS-type assault rifles. 



A witness saw Turner with a long gun and Stewart with a handgun, but it doesn't appear any handgun bullets were recovered at the scene.

incidents.narrative: Conner Schierman, 24, entered a neighbor's house while the man was deployed with the Army National Guard in Iraq. He fatally stabbed the man's wife, two young sons and sister-in-law. He bought gasoline and torched the house. He received a death sentence.
incidents.weapon: Gasoline

incidents.narrative: Matthew Timothy Wetherington, a 34-year-old registered sex offender, was arrested for allegedly setting fire to his mobile home in the early morning of July 6, 2019, killing his wife and three children inside. Wetherington and his wife Valerie Kambeitz were married two months prior to the incident.

Gerry Dean Zaragoza, 26, went on a shooting rampage in the San Fernando Valley killing four (including his father and brother) and injuring two others (including his mother). The other two slain victims were a mother of four with whom Zaragoza had been obsessed for some time and a man whom he shot on a bus.  The shooting spree started in Canoga Park, then to North Hollywood, Sherman Oaks and Van Nuys where Zaragoza was arrested.

Police came upon Patrick Dell, 32, as he shot himself on the front steps of his estranged wife's home. Inside, officers found the wife and four of her children shot dead. A fifth boy, 12, was wounded. Dell's biological children were unharmed.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - .357-caliber Ruger Six Shot Revolver, Model GP100, Serial # 172-87755

incidents.narrative: Tuan Dao, 37, had separated from his wife and was facing financial problems. His wife had gotten a protective order against him. He and his five children, ages 6 to 12, died in a fire he set in their home. An older daughter and his wife were not home.

Angelica Alvarez, 27, strangled her four children, ranging in age from 2 through 8. Psychiatrists debated her mental health and eventually she  was ruled competent to stand trial. She was sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.

Jared Lee Loughner went to an event for Rep. Gabrielle Giffords and shot her and constituents waiting to speak with her. Six died and 13 others, including Giffords, were hurt. Loughner pleaded guilty in 2013 to avoid the death penalty and was sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: 9mm Glock 19 semiautomatic pistol, at least 2 30-round magazines

incidents.narrative: A couple and their two sons were killed at milepost 149 on the Florida Turnpike in a drug trade case. Gunmen Daniel Troya, 23, and Ricardo Sanchez Jr., 23, are on death row. Their boss, Daniel Varela, 26, is serving two life terms plus 60 years.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber handgun and 9mm handgun - "St. Lucie County Sheriffs Office firearm and toolmark analyst Mark Chapman told jurors he believed the bullets had several unique markings that matched the .40-caliber and 9mm bullets recovered at the scene of the slayings." (Palm Beach Post (Florida) February 24, 2009)

incidents.narrative: Mesac Damas, a Naples, Fla., restaurant cook, faces charges that he slashed the throats of his wife and five children and later fled to Haiti. He has been found competent to stand trial and subsequently sentenced to death.

Paul Merhige, 35, had been treated for depression and obsessive-compulsive disorder. At Thanksgiving dinner, he shot his aunt, twin sisters and cousin and wounded two others. He pleaded guilty to avoid the death penalty and will spend life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Handgun – .40-caliber (never recovered) and a Smith & Wesson .38-caliber handgun – verbally confirmed by Jupiter Police Spokesperson Scott Pascarella to Hannan.

incidents.narrative: Gerardo Regalado's wife had moved out and started a new job. The couple fought in the parking lot, where he shot her, and then he ran into the restaurant where she worked, targeting women. Four died and three were injured. Regalado committed suicide.
incidents.weapon:
Handgun - .45-caliber Glock pistol  (NYPD – Active Shooter pdf - http://www.nyc.gov/html/nypd/html/counterterrorism/active_shooter.shtml  )  



Suspect had concealed weapons permit and bought gun legally.

incidents.narrative: Police arrested Henry Segura in Minnesota 10 months after his ex-girlfriend and three children were found dead in their home.  Peters and Tamiyah were shot at their Saddle Creek Run home. The other children were drowned and all three were left in a partially filled bathtub. Before the killings, Segura had been ordered to pay back $20,000 in child support for his son. He was convicted of murder in November 2019.

In a protective-order affidavit, Tan Do's wife said he threated to kill her when she tried to leave him. But she asked in March that the order be dismissed. In June, Do shot and killed her, four of her relatives and himself at their son's birthday party.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - .Glock 23 40-caliber semiautomatic pistol (FOIA Incident Report)

incidents.narrative: Shayne Riggleman, 22, had been diagnosed as bipolar. He killed five people -- family and friends of a couple who had taken in his ex-girlfriend. He then hit a woman with his car and shot a gas station attendant before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: 30-30 deer rifle. A second 30-30 rifle and a .22-caliber handgun, both fully loaded, found in suspect’s vehicle

incidents.narrative: John Ragin's wife had taken out a protective order against him, but police hadn't served it before they found her and three of their children stabbed to death. Ragin was convicted of capital murder and sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Knife

incidents.narrative: Alan Atwater, 31, used a .22-caliber rifle to shoot his wife and three children, ages 1, 2, and 4, then himself. She had told him and her friends that she wanted to separate, according to court documents.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber rifle

incidents.narrative: Firefighters responding to a blaze at Fero's Bar & Grill found five people inside stabbed to death. Joseph Hill pleaded guilty to murder and received a life sentence. His brother Lynell was sentenced to 70 years. Dexter Lewis was sentenced to life.
No arrests have been made in the slayings of four people ages 16 to 34 inside a Detroit home. The day after the bodies were found, the house was torched by an arsonist and destroyed.

A family had just finished opening Christmas presents when a relative dressed as Santa Claus opened fire, killing six before shooting himself. Azizolah "Bob" Yazdanpanah faced foreclosure and had recently separated from his wife, one of the victims.
incidents.weapon: 9mm hangun, .40-caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: David Ison will serve life in prison in the fatal shootings of five people in a rural part of Indiana. According to police reports, Ison had previously purchased drugs from on one of his victims. They fought over the price of the prescription medication.
incidents.weapon: Ruger .380-caliber semiautomatic handgun. AK-47 assault rifle found in suspect's car.

incidents.narrative: A pharmacy robbery ended with David Laffer shooting four people, including two store employees, before fleeing with 10,000 hydrocodone pills. His wife, a painkiller addict, drove the getaway car. Laffer received four life sentences without parole, and she received a 25 year sentence for her role.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: Esteban Quintero Gonzales forced his way into a trailer and shot and killed four people inside, including his two children and their mother, before killing himself. The couple had been involved in an ongoing custody dispute, sheriff's deputies said.
incidents.weapon: Shotgun

incidents.narrative: Susan Hendricks received four life sentences after pleading guilty but mentally ill to the slayings of her two sons, ex-husband and another family member. Hendricks, who suffered from multiple mental illnesses, committed the crimes for insurance money.
incidents.weapon: .38-caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: Jose Avila-Alva's wife refused to file domestic assault charges after an incident the week before. He opened fire on his four children in the family's front yard, killing them and committing suicide. His wife was injured but survived the shooting.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber revolver stolen in 2010.

incidents.narrative: After he was fired from a Minneapolis sign company, Andrew J. Engeldinger shot and killed five people before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm Glock semiautomatic handgun.

incidents.narrative: Jeong Soo Paek entered his sisters' suburban Atlanta spa and shot them and their husbands before killing himself. In 2006, one sister had gotten a temporary restraining order against Paek, who had threatened to harm them with guns at the salon.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Wade M. Page, 40, lead guitarist in a white-power band named End Apathy, entered a Sikh temple in Oak Creek, Wis., and killed six with a handgun. He wounded three, including a police officer. After police shot Page in the stomach, he killed himself.
incidents.weapon: Springfield Armory XDM 9 mm handgun purchased legally at a gun shop in West Allis, Wisc.

incidents.narrative: A former nursing student is accused of using a handgun to kill seven at Oikos University, a small private college in East Oakland. One Goh has been treated in a state mental hospital ever since, but in October 2015 was deemed competent to stand trial.
incidents.weapon: Springfield Arms .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun – 10 round magazines

incidents.narrative: Jason "J.T." Ready, a well-known white supremacist who had run for public office, shot his girlfriend, three of her family members and then himself. In February, police told Ready's girlfriend to get a protective order against him; she declined.
incidents.weapon:
Beretta 9mm Semiautomatic handgun – murder weapon



Home Weapons Cache: 



Raven .22-caliber Semiautomatic handgun



Camouflaged CMMG Model 45A (AR15-styled) semiautomatic rifle with grenade launcher with spare grenades - Serial #5A20876



Black Mossburg Shotgun Serial #P740985



.22-caliber Rifle



Camouflaged Modified AR15 .223-caliber semiautomatic rifle with MWG Grip



Bushmaster AR15 Model XM15-E28 .223-caliber semiautomatic rifle - Serial #BF1648593

incidents.narrative: Five men in a homeless camp were killed in a drug-debt dispute, police say. David Cruz Ponce and Max Eliseo Rafael each were charged with five special-circumstance counts of murder. Both pleaded not guilty and were convicted. Ponce was sentenced to death and Rafael was sentenced to life.
Ian Lee Stawicki, 40, entered a Seattle coffee shop and shot and killed four. He then killed a woman for her car, leading police on a chase that ended with Stawicki killing himself.
