incidents.weapon: A pair of .45-caliber handguns. Purchased at Bullseye Shooter Supply in Tacoma, the same store the DC sniper purchased rifles at. Suspect in this case bought guns legally because he had no felonies or restrictions to purchase firearms.

incidents.narrative: Tonya Thomas killed her four teenage and pre-teen children, shooting them a total of 18 times before killing herself. Three of the kids went to a neighbor's house to say their mother shot them, but Thomas called them back inside.
incidents.weapon: Taurus .38-caliber revolver

incidents.narrative: A man facing prison described himself as despondent before he shot his girlfriend and three teenage relatives as they slept. Cedric Anderson, who a month earlier had been found guilty of heroin possession, set the house afire and then committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: .357 Magnum handgun

incidents.narrative: Nikolay Lazukin shot his wife and two daughters, suffocated his infant and set the house ablaze. He also used a baseball bat to kill a neighbor who was walking nearby. Lazukin killed himself after sending an apologetic text message to his father-in-law.
incidents.weapon: .380-caliber semiautomatic handgun, baseball bat (Matlock),suffocation (infant)

incidents.narrative: Five people were killed in their home with what prosecutors have described as a "blunt instrument." No motive has been revealed. Binh Thai Luc, 35, has pleaded not guilty to five counts of murder, robbery, burglary and lying in wait. He was convicted and sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: Police described as "an edged weapon"

incidents.narrative: Five men playing poker inside a Birmingham home were shot to death. Police said the slayings started as a robbery. Reginald Mims was sentenced to 25 years. Artavius Underwood and Rashad Stoves are serving life in prison.
incidents.weapon: (2) 9mm handguns, .38-caliber revolver.  Additional semiautomatic “at hand” but not used according to a witness.

incidents.narrative: Officials said a financial dispute resulted in two men killing girlfriends and others connected with a drug ring associate. Zakkawanda Moss was convicted and sentenced to life in prison. Henry Lee Burrell was convicted and sentenced to life.

Ten people died and six were injured after Michael McLendon, 28, went to several relatives' homes firing an assault rifle. According to a letter McLendon sent police, he was depressed he could not be a police officer or Marine. He committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: AR-15(Bushmaster), SKS rifle (AK-style), 12-gauge shotgun, .38 caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: Kalcie Eagle, 21, lived a block away from the family he is accused of killing. A grandmother and three of her grandchildren were shot in their home. A 12-year-old who played dead called 911. Eagle stabbed himself to death in front of police hours later.
incidents.weapon: .25-06 “hunting” rifle – “The official reports of death signed by Dr. William Massello say Martha Johnson and the three children were shot at 3 p.m. with a 25-06 rifle.” (Bismarck Tribune, November 26, 2012)

incidents.narrative: The killer entered a Lane Bryant store on a Saturday morning and announced he was robbing the store. He ordered six women to the back of the store where he bound and shot them. Five died. The case remains unsolved.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Facing a brain tumor and a bitter divorce, James Butwin killed his wife and three children, loaded their bodies in an SUV, took it to the desert and set it afire. A  business partner called police after finding "blood everywhere" at the family's home.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber semiautomatic handgun – Sgt. Mike Pooley – Tempe PD PIO

incidents.narrative: Mark Leo Gregory Gago, 42, used an axe to kill his parents, his girlfriend and their infant daughter before deputies shot him as he was attempting to kill his girlfriend's daughter. Some of the victims were beheaded. The one girl and a 40-year-old roommate were injured but survived the attack.
incidents.weapon: Axe

incidents.narrative: Hector Celaya was in a lengthy custody dispute involving his three children. He shot his mother, two uncles and son on the Tule Indian Reservation before fleeing with two daughters. Before he was shot by police, Celaya shot both girls, killing one.
incidents.weapon: Rohm RG38 .38-caliber revolver - 6 round capacity - Originally shipped to Alamo Leather Goods, March 30,1979, 16101 College Oak Drive, San Antonio Texas - now out of business. No information tying killer with weapon purchase (ATF Firearms Trace Report)

incidents.narrative: In his sentencing hearing, Jordan Adam Criado said he killed his wife only after she killed the couple's four children. Yet a judge said evidence was "overwhelming" that Criado had stabbed and smothered his kids. Criado was sentenced to life in prison.

Forty hours after gaining custody of her deceased sister's three kids, Mary Ann Holder shot and killed two of them, along with two of her own and her son's girlfriend. Police said the stress of the custody case, along with an ended affair, contributed.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - Smith & Wesson .32-caliber long revolver - Guilford County Sheriff BJ Barnes.   "All were killed by shots to the head with a .38-caliber handgun," the state medical examiner's office in Chapel Hill found."

incidents.narrative: A man who wanted to abandon his family to live in the Canadian wilderness pulled over their Ford Expedition on an isolated road and shot his wife and three kids. Christopher Vaughn, 32, will spend the rest of his life in prison.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun

incidents.narrative: Rodrick Shonte Dantzler shot himself at the end of a rampage that took the lives of seven people, including his wife, her parents, their daughter and an ex-girlfriend. Dantzler had a history of threats against women, according to court records.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber handgun. Had been stolen.

incidents.narrative: Using two handguns, Michael Hance went on a shooting spree, killing seven neighbors and relatives of his live-in girlfriend. His girlfriend was injured in the attack. Police fatally shot Hance outside a suburban home 10 minutes after the shooting began.
incidents.weapon: Hi-Point .45 ACP, .357 Magnum Revolver. Legally purchased at a Barberton, Ohio, pawn shop (Sydmor's Jewelry) a week earlier

incidents.narrative: Scott Lamar Abbott has been hospitalized for mental health issues at least four times. He was sentenced to life without parole after stabbing his ex-girlfriend and three others 95 times. Prosecutors said he was angry about the breakup.

Four bricklayers were beaten, stabbed and robbed in their apartment, 1,600 miles from home: Villa de Ramos, Mexico. Their roommate Santiago Moreno  was convicted in Mexico, which won't extradite citizens facing the death penalty. Sentence: 120 years.
incidents.weapon: Knife

incidents.narrative: Sara McMeen, 30, struggled with bipolar medication and postpartum depression. She shot her live-in boyfriend, two children and her 10-month-old daughter before killing herself. Forty years before, her father shot his first wife in a schizophrenic episode.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A birthday party ended in violence when a woman's estranged husband burst into her  house and shot her, her boyfriend, and two members of her family, police said. Guillermo Lopez, 48, set his truck and home on fire before he killed himself.
incidents.weapon: semi-automatic handgun - Reuters

incidents.narrative: Randle Lee Roberts spared the life of an 8-year-old girl but gunned down the rest of her family, including her mother and 11-year-old sister, as they slept. Roberts fled but was killed in a shootout with police later that day.
incidents.weapon: Weapon: Two semiautomatic handguns, one was .40-caliber.

incidents.narrative: A month after being fired from his brother's moving firm, Edwin Rivera, 20, shot and killed his father, two brothers and a police officer during a standoff at his home. He was killed by a police sniper's bullet as he fled a fire caused by stun grenades.
incidents.weapon: .380 caliber pistol, 32 Magnum Charter Arms revolver/pistol and a 12-gauge Savage Arms double-barreled shotgun – found in home but not near gunman’s body.

incidents.narrative: A woman, her two sons and one son's girlfriend were found in the embers of her home. They had died of gunshots or beating. Troy Brake, 31, was convicted of their murders and is serving life in prison without possibility of parole.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber Glock handgun. Brown was beaten around the head (no weapon specified)

incidents.narrative: Jason Dej-Oudom shot and killed his children in their apartment before chasing his wife through parking lots, killing her. He later committed suicide.
Gaylin Leirmoe killed his sons, their mother, and her sister at their home before setting fire to it and killing himself.

Prosecutors say recordings show a landlord told his handyman to torch a wood-frame house. The fire trapped three adults and four kids in the attic. Lawrence Myers was sentenced to life in prison; maintenance man Marion Cormier awaits trial.
incidents.weapon: Oil and gasoline

incidents.narrative: A 5-year-old boy escaped and told neighbors "Daddy's dead" right after Robert Brazzon shot his ex-brother-in-law, his wife and their teenage son. Brazzon earlier had killed his live-in girlfriend. Brazzon shot himself after a brief standoff with police.
incidents.weapon: Smith and Wesson .45-caliber revolver

incidents.narrative: The 15-year-old son of a pastor has been charged as an adult. He is accused of using his parents' guns to shoot his mother, father and three siblings. Police said Nehemiah Griego said he wanted to die while in a gunfight with authorities.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber rifle, .223-caliber AR-15

incidents.narrative: Kevin Garner's divorce hearing was scheduled to begin the next day. His estranged wife, teenage daughter, and his wife's sister and niece were found shot dead in their home. Garner's body was found 70 miles away, in his house, which he set on fire.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun

incidents.narrative: After arguing with his wife, a Vietnamese immigrant threw their three children plus his wife's child off the 80-foot Dauphin Island bridge to their deaths. Lam Luong's death sentence conviction was overturned; he awaits a second trial.
incidents.weapon: None

incidents.narrative: Kirby Archer, 35, and Guillermo Zarabozo, 19, chartered and hijacked the Joe Cool, a Miami-based fishing boat. They shot and dumped overboard its crew of four, planning to flee to Cuba. They pleaded guilty to murder and were sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: A pair of Glock 9 mm handguns

incidents.narrative: Kurt Myers, 64, shot four people, two fatally, at a barbershop In Mohawk, NY before killing two others at a car wash in the next town of Herkimer. He held police in an overnight standoff before they swarmed and killed him. Authorities do not know what provoked the attacks.
incidents.weapon: Mossberg 590 12-gauge pump-action shotgun - Myers legally obtained in 1996

incidents.narrative: Aunterrio Barney was arrested in North Carolina months after a purposely set fire killed three adults and a 2-year-old boy. Barney had faced the death penalty, but because Illinois has banned it, he now will serve a mandatory life sentence.

Matthew Denton, 17, drove his Chevrolet Suburban at 97 mph into a Dodge Caravan moving at 50-55 mph., killing himself and those in the other vehicle: a woman, her ex-husband, their son and his girlfriend. The coroner ruled the act a murder-suicide.
incidents.weapon: Auto accident

incidents.narrative: Derrick Brantley and Deshanon Haywood were charged in the execution-style killings of four people in a townhouse in a public-housing complex. Brantley and Haywood were each sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: "2 guns used" Akron PD

incidents.narrative: Rick Odell Smith, 43, was shot by police shortly after the slayings of five family members. Smith carried an injured 6-year-old next door and asked neighbors to take her to the hospital. He had been in a custody dispute with a relative of the victims.
incidents.weapon: Winchester 20-gauge pump-action shotgun, murder weapon - in vehicle: .270 bolt-action Winchester rifle with a scope, a Ruger carbine rifle and a Gerber Gator machete that according to the firm's website has an 18-inch blade on one side and an 18-inch "high performance" saw blade on the other, Monique Bond, Illinois State Police said.

incidents.narrative: Samuel Sallee was found guilty of four counts of murder.The sheriff said methamphetamine was found at the rural home where a couple and two of their friends had been shot. Sallee was sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Knife, gun (casings found) and rifle(not certain if this was used)

incidents.narrative: Four children sleeping upstairs died after the house was set on fire. Four people, including the children's parents, were able to escape from the lower floors. Derrick J. Twardoski pleaded guilty to one count of murder and received a 53-year sentence.

A husband, wife and their three children were bludgeoned with a tire iron. Their former son-in-law, Christopher Harris, did it, according to his brother Jason, who admitted that he watched. Prison sentences: Life and 20 years, respectively.

Three women and a man were found shot in a house about 3 a.m. after neighbors reported hearing gunshots. Two men were arrested the following month. They face  charges that carry the death penalty. The case is pending.

Erbie Bowser faces capital murder charges in the slayings of his ex-girlfriend and her daughter in Dallas. Bowser was arrested 15 minutes away, inside the home of his ex-wife, who was found shot dead with her adult daughter. Four children were injured. Bowser was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 7.62 x 25 caliber cartridge casings found inside the homes. A hand grenade was used in DeSoto.

incidents.narrative: When Daniel Green, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, stopped taking his meds, he had violent episodes, relatives said. Green has been declared not competent for trial in the shootings of his mother, sister, niece and nephew.
incidents.weapon: .380 semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Aaron Alexis, 34, killed 12 and injured eight in an office building at the Washington Navy Yard. The former Navy reservist was killed by police. Alexis worked for a base subcontractor.
incidents.weapon: Remington 870 Express shotgun, Beretta 9mm semiautomatic handgun (stolen from Navy Yard Security Guard Alexis shot).  Shotgun and its ammo  purchased 2 days earlier for $540 from Sharpshooters Small Arms Range (Lorton, Virginia).  Shotgun was legally purchased.  Early reports that he carried an AR-15 were untrue.

incidents.narrative: Tyrone M. Adair, 38, shot himself four days after police found his girlfriend's and infant daughter's bodies in the trunk of his car. His ex-girlfriend and a 2-year-old daughter were shot at their home. Adair was out of work and faced child support costs.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun - Madison PD PIO Joel DeSpain

incidents.narrative: The bodies of a man, his girlfriend and two children were found naked in the woods a mile from their vehicle. Police said the killings occurred over a drug debt. James Roy Belknap received a life sentence for four counts of first-degree murder.

Two men, a young woman and her 2-year-old son were beaten to death in their apartment. Nicholas Sheley was found guilty of murder. Sheley, who faces a trial in the murder of an Arkansas couple, is already serving a life sentence for two other killings.
incidents.weapon: Blunt force

incidents.narrative: A 7-year-old girl watched as her mother was shot. She then grabbed her brother and walked four miles to a neighbor's house to call 911. Kenneth Lee Myers, 47, shot his wife - the girl's mother - two relatives and an ex-girlfriend before he killed himself.
incidents.weapon: 20-gauge shotgun

incidents.narrative: Police say the 4:30 a.m. shooting appeared to be drug-related, and that a father-son newspaper delivery team just happened to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. Sidney A. Muller has been charged with four counts of first-degree murder. He was convicted and given a life sentence.
incidents.weapon: 9mm Beretta semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Authorities said three teens and a young woman were shot in a car. Jacob Allen Bennett was convicted and sentenced to life without parole. His girlfriend, Brittany Moser, faced charges of felony murder and attempted robbery, and was convicted.
incidents.weapon: News reports say a .40mm Glock semiautomatic handgun - "the suspected murder waepon" was found in Moser's car at her house.

incidents.narrative: A couple and their three children were found shot in their home. Authorities said Guadalupe Ronquillo-Ovalle killed her spouse and children, then herself. Her husband had been arrested Sept. 11 on a family violence assault charge.
incidents.weapon: .22-caliber semi-automatic long rifle

incidents.narrative: A woman called police to report that she heard "someone got shot." Responding officers found four men dead inside the house. Police said the shooting did not appear to be random, but have made no arrests.
Two men and two women were found shot in a small house in the Southeastside neighborhood. Police said this occurred during a robbery of money and illegal drugs.
incidents.weapon: (1) .38/357 class Revolver and (1) .380 semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Oliver Bernsdorff killed himself while driving across the Sunshine Skyway. Police found his ex-wife and her girlfriend dead at their home in Largo. At Bernsdorff's Clearwater home, they found the bodies of his two children, ages 4 and 2.
incidents.weapon: Paid $321 cash for the 9 mm handgun

incidents.narrative: Authorities found four bodies after putting out a house fire. A couple had been shot execution-style. Two boys survived gunshots but died in the blaze. Two men were charged but found not guilty. The case remains unsolved.
incidents.weapon: multiple guns used in the shootings

incidents.narrative: The bodies of four adults were discovered outside a car in a recreation area near Phoenix International Raceway. All had been shot. There have been no arrests.

Police found Jason Abbott, 18, on his grandparents' porch, a knife to his throat. Inside, they found his grandparents, his aunt and her fiance, all fatally stabbed. Another aunt survived. He pleaded guilty and gets schizophrenia treatment in prison.
incidents.weapon: Police described weapon as a Smith and Wesson dagger with a 5-inch blade.

incidents.narrative: Police were called by a man saying he wanted to hurt himself. After failing to make contact with anyone inside the home, a SWAT team discovered the bodies of five victims, two of them children. Bryan E. Sweatt, 27, had committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: "large-caliber handgun" reported to be a .44-caliber, per 911 call.

incidents.narrative: An itinerant man is charged with stabbing his cousin's wife and her four children after briefly staying with the family. Police found Mingdong Chen at the scene covered in blood. Chen pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 125 years to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Meat cleaver

incidents.narrative: Michael Guzzo, 56, used a shotgun to kill the family next door -- a man, his daughter, her husband and their son. He also killed two of their five dogs. He crossed a courtyard, fired into a unit where dogs were barking, returned home and killed himself.
incidents.weapon: Pump-action shotgun

incidents.narrative: Charles Everett Brownlow Jr., 36, is charged with killing five people in three separate homes and a convenience store over a span of six hours. He was arrested after being chased in a vehicle and on foot. He was convicted and sentenced to death.

Authorities have made no arrests in the case of two sisters and two men shot to death inside a home in Jacksonville's Murray Hill neighborhood. There was no sign of forced entry. Three died at the scene, while a fourth died at the hospital.

Police are searching for a suspect after four adults were found shot inside a Tulsa home. Six children were unharmed and placed in foster care. The house had been the scene of several drug arrests in the past year, police said.

After finding a woman in an alley with gunshot wounds, police found her car and then her house half a mile away, where her brother, ex-husband and another woman lay dead of gunshots. The first victim died two days later. No arrests have been made.
incidents.weapon: Undetermined gun(s)

incidents.narrative: At their home in Spanish Fork, Utah, a police officer shot his wife, 2 young children, his mother-in-law and himself.
incidents.weapon: Glock .40 Caliber semiautomatic handgun – Police issue - confirmed

incidents.narrative: A petroleum industry engineer, his wife and two young sons were found shot in their home about a week after they were last seen alive. Police say they have no suspects.
incidents.weapon: Shooting, gun type unknown

incidents.narrative: Police said that at an eviction hearing, a woman used a handgun to shoot five people, four of them fatally, and grabbed a butcher knife to wound a sixth before she was subdued.
incidents.weapon: Police chief: 2 semiautomatic handguns, butcher knife - 9mm semi-automatic handgun was murder weapon

incidents.narrative: Five men were tortured, beaten, electrocuted and slashed in what authorities said was a contract killing. Members of a Mexican drug cartel were angry over $450,000 that was missing. Four men went to prison.

Leonard Egland killed his estranged wife, her boyfriend and the man's son. He took his own daughter, 7, to Bucks County, Pa., killed his mother-in-law, dropped his daughter at a hospital, wounded two policemen, escaped and killed himself that night.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic rifle fired at SWAT teams, handgun flashed at hospital orderly

incidents.narrative: Maksim Gelman was sentenced to 200 years in prison in connection to a daylong string of stabbing attacks and carjackings. Four people died and four were injured. A manhunt for Gelman ended when police arrested him in Times Square.

Sonny Enrique Medina, 36, shot Maria Navas, 29, and their three daughters, ages 10, 6 and 2, then himself. Navas had talked about leaving her common-law husband, according to a police report. She was found with numerous bruises on her arms and face.
Shanynthia Gardner, reportedly suffering from mental illness, stabbed her children and superficially cut herself. Her seven-year-old son managed to escape and alert the authorities.
A 27-year-old woman, her new boyfriend and her parents were found buried a mile from their home. Her former boyfriend, who lived with the family, has been  charged.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun, blunt object.

incidents.narrative: Police said Brandon Howell severely beat an elderly couple and fatally shot three neighbors. The couple died a week later. Howell faced a dozen charges, including three counts of first-degree murder. He was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge shotgun

incidents.narrative: Don Charles Spirit called police to say he had killed his adult daughter and six grandchildren, ages 3 months to 11 years, and planned to kill himself. Authorities had investigated the family for child abuse and neglect charges 18 times from 2006 to 2014.
incidents.weapon: .45 caliber handgun. As of Sept. 23: "Federal, state and local officials are investigating how he obtained the weapon."

incidents.narrative: A 15-year-old used text messages to draw several cousins and friends to his cafeteria table at Marysville-Pilchuck High School. He shot five, four of them fatally, before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: Beretta PX4 Storm .40-caliber semi-automatic handgun, bought legally and registered to killer's father

incidents.narrative: A 9-year-old girl survived a gunshot to call police about a shooting that left five dead at a Wade Park home. James E. Henderson was arrested six months later and charged with aggravated murder. He was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Six people were killed at three locations in suburban Philadelphia. After a daylong manhunt, police found the body of suspect Bradley William Stone, a former Marine, in the woods near his home. Stone's ex-wife and five of her family members died.

According to a medical examiner's report, Joel Smith, 33, had sought help for anxiety but was not taking antidepressants because he had lost his insurance. Smith shot his wife, stepson and two children before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: 12-gauge shotgun

incidents.narrative: The Santa Barbara County sheriff said dispatchers received a call from a man who calmly told them he had just stabbed his parents and two sons at the home they all shared. Nicholas Holzer was convicted and sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: Stabbing - Kitchen knives(2)

incidents.narrative: Timothy Ray Jones Jr. led investigators to the bodies of his five children, ages 1 through 8, buried off a dirt road in Alabama. According to police, the children died days earlier in Lexington County, S.C. Jones was charged with five counts of murder. He was convicted and sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: Beaten to death (Nahtahn Jones); All others strangulation

incidents.narrative: The bodies of two adults and two young boys were found in their home.
incidents.weapon:
The World Journal, October 2014 (Chinese langauge newspaper in NYC's Chinatown)  reports that victim Li's father shared autopsy report with World Journal reporters and it stated, "a knife and a hammer were used, causing head and facial fractures."  State Polce would not comment or release details of the autopsy report.



Initial reports said victims were shot, now various sources have reported they were either stabbed or died from blunt force trauma.

incidents.narrative: Police originally described the slayings of a couple, their daughter and a family acquaintance as a murder/suicide. But six days later authorities charged the couple's adult son, Ryan Champion was charged with four counts of murder in the shootings. He was convicted and sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Four men were shot inside a stolen car double-parked on a street. No arrests have been made. Police said the attack was likely gang-related.

A fire set to a one-room trailer concealed a mother and three young children stabbed to death inside. Authorities had gone to the home twice the day before because of a domestic dispute. Husband and father Jonathan Camacho has been charged with murder.

A meeting between five biker gangs at a restaurant escalated into a shootout that killed nine gang members and wounded 18. Police arrested 177 people and found more than 300 weapons, including an AK-47. Officers received and returned gunfire in the melee. After four years, the murder charges were dropped.

Michael Augustine Bournes killed his wife and toddler inside their remote cabin, then went outside and shot his two young sons. He brought their bodies inside, lay them down together, and then set the building on fire and shot and killed himself.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Authorities responding to shots fired at a rural residence found a man dead in the front yard and a woman and two teenagers shot dead inside. An 8-year-old boy was taken to the hospital. Four offenders were arrested and charged with murder.

Four Marines and a Naval officer died when a gunman attacked a military training center after having shot up a military recruitment office earlier. Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, 24, was killed by a police officer at the scene.
incidents.weapon: AR-15 semiautomatic rifle

incidents.narrative: Thomas Jesse Lee pleaded guilty but mentally ill to five counts of malice murder in the slayings of his wife, her parents, her daughter and a family friend. Their bodies were found at a home where Lee had been staying. Lee is sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: four out of five victims shot with a  .22 caliber handgun

incidents.narrative: Police said that Cedric Prather approached his ex-wife's home and began shooting. He killed her and another man and two children and wounded two more children before shooting himself fatally.
incidents.weapon: ".45-caliber handgun"

incidents.narrative: Police found eight people shot, seven fatally, in four homes at a rural crossroads. Police said they suspected Joseph Aldridge, 36. He was soon found dead of a self-inflicted gunshot in his pickup truck on a road about 15 miles east.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Three women and a man were found shot "execution style" in a home on the northwest side of Indianapolis. Police said someone had forced entry, and that the killings were not random. No arrests have been made.

A dispute over how to run the family limosine business ended with Driss M. Diaeddinn shooting his two brothers, mother and sister-in-law at home. His wife and children escaped. Diaeddinn held police at bay for hours before committing suicide.
incidents.weapon: Semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Police arrested Daron Dylan Wint, whose DNA was found on a pizza crust inside the home of a local CEO. Authorities believe the CEO, his wife, 10-year-old son and housekeeper were held captive before they were killed and their house set ablaze. Wint was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: Bloody baseball bat admitted into evidence.

incidents.narrative: Sixteen-year-old Jordyn D. Wade and Robert Lee Adams Jr., 27, are charged with murder and kidnapping. Two men and two women were killed; another woman was injured. Adams fled the state, but was arrested months later in Mississippi. Adams was convicted and sentenced to life without parole. Wade was convicted and sentenced to 172 years.

Police were preparing to arrest Martin Martinez in connection with the 2014 death of his 2-year-old son when they were called to a home and found Martinez' former girlfriend, her mother, and three children - including Martinez's infant daughter - dead.
incidents.weapon: Knife

incidents.narrative: The bodies of a woman and her three children were found decomposing inside their fire-damaged home. It was unclear when they died. Medical examiners determined the woman had been strangled to death and the children died from smoke inhalation.

Deputies arrested David Conley on capital murder charges after a standoff at a home he once shared with a woman he dated. The woman, her husband and six children were found dead inside. Conley faced earlier assault charges against the same female victim.

Jody Herring, 40, was tackled by onlookers after social worker Lara Sobel was shot dead outside a state office building. Sobel had handled a case involving Herring's daughter. Hours later, three of Herring's relatives were found shot dead in their home.
incidents.weapon: Remington Model 700 -  270 caliber bolt-action rifle.

incidents.narrative: Five family members were found dead in their home. Authorities said Brian S. Short, 45, killed his wife and teenagers before killing himself. Acquaintances and family members said Short was depressed because his Internet business was struggling.
incidents.weapon: A day or two before Brian Short shot and killed his wife, three children and himself, he bought a Remington 12-gauge shotgun from an Eden Prairie Gandar Mountain outdoors store.

incidents.narrative: State police found two adults and two children; the adults were shot while the children died of smoke inhalation from the fire, apparently set to cover up evidence of the murders. The assailant was convicted and given a life sentence.
incidents.weapon: gun and fire

incidents.narrative: Firefighters responding to a house fire in Rochester, N.Y. discovered four victims and quickly determined the house was a crime scene. No further details are available. police are investigating it as a homicide.
incidents.weapon: gun

incidents.narrative: A 26-year-old shot and killed his mother, father, and two younger sisters in their family home before being killed by police. The suspect also set the house on fire, impeding police efforts to rescue any potential survivors.
incidents.weapon: gun

incidents.narrative: Dibon Toone beat his wife and their children to death, covering their faces with blankets and clothing. He then stole a company car, drove to Virginia, and turned himself in to police.

A man walked into his neighbor’s house with an AK-47-styled rifle and opened fire, killing four.  He then fled the scene and killed another man in Montgomery County, Missouri, some 170 miles west of Kansas City, Kansas.
incidents.weapon: Ak-47 styled rifle or shotgun, conflicting reports

incidents.narrative: Hopped up on meth, Derrick Dearman drove to a home and killed five (including a pregnant woman), before kidnapping his ex-girlfriend and driving her to a relative's home in MS.

Police say Glenn Edward Baxter, 27, deliberately drove his estranged wife's SUV into a suburban lake, with Danica Baxter, 25, and the couple's three young children seatbelted inside. The whole family drowned.
Michael Scott, 59, and his wife Cathy, 60, along with their aging moms Barbara Scott, 80 and Violet Taylor, 82, were shot to death by an unknown assailant in their mobile home.
incidents.weapon: gun

incidents.narrative: Six people were killed while camping on one of the victim's newly purchased land. Four men and a six-year-old were shot after getting help pulling their vehicle out of mud; a woman was beaten to death. William Hudson was convicted and sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: gun and blunt object

incidents.narrative: Police responding to a welfare check found one person dead, and a barricaded gunman in a second home nearby. After several hours of negotiations, police entered and found the suspect dead, along with four others. Police say all victims were related.
incidents.weapon: handgun

incidents.narrative: After a welfare check, police found the bodies of six family members inside their home.  Five of the victims, including children ages 10 and 13, died from sharp or blunt force injuries while the final victim was shot to death.
incidents.weapon: Gun/Knives (Chicago police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi said investigators believe three "bladed weapons," which were either knives or other cutting instruments, were used in most of the killings.

incidents.narrative: A 45-year-old Uber driver went on a shooting rampage killing six and seriously wounding two.  According to police, in between the shootings he continued to pick up and deliver passengers to their destinations.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semi-automatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A man and his wife, their granddaughter and her three-month-old son, were found shot to death outside their home. Their bodies had also been set on fire. Grayden Denham was arrested and trial is pending.
incidents.weapon: Gun and shotgun

incidents.narrative: A husband shot and killed his wife, her two adopted children from a previous marriage and a neighbor before killing himself during a standoff with police. A 12-year-old girl survived unharmed.

A man shot and killed five people in two locations as a result of a domestic dispute before taking his own life as police closed in.  Some of the victims were reportedly members of his estranged wife's family, though she was not among those killed.

Five friends were shot and killed by a friend who then set the house they were staying in on fire. Peacock told investigators he had gone out to get everyone breakfast and when he returned the house was in flames. However, he was convicted and given a life sentence.
incidents.weapon: gun

incidents.narrative: Four people were shot dead in a car that had been set on fire; two of the victims were in the trunk, and the other two were in the backseat.

A heavily armed gunman shot his way into a gay nightclub killing 49 and injuring 53, many of them critically. The gunman, who was killed by responding SWAT officers, recently pledged allegiance to ISIL.
incidents.weapon: .223 caliber Sig Sauer MCX (AR-15-styled rifle), 9mm semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: A man killed his wife and four daughters before fleeing to Mexico where he was apprehended.  The extradition process is underway. Local police believe a domestic dispute led to the deadly shootings.
incidents.weapon: .22 caliber gun – not clear whether it’s a handgun or rife – .22 caliber shell casings were found.

incidents.narrative: A dispute between two homeless men living in a vacant building led one of them to start a fire that not only killed the man he intended to kill, but four others as well. Cadaver dogs found the other homeless victims after the fire was put out.
incidents.weapon: Fire

incidents.narrative: After serving time for killing his pregnant wife in 1991, Gregory Green married the daughter of the pastor that had helped secure his release. He later tortured and tied her up, making her watch as he killed their children.
Jacob Kosky and Matthew Baker attended a bonfire party in Jackson, Georgia before returning and killing four.
Dereck Harris shot and killed four members of a family related to a drug debt.
Marlon Jones went to a birthday party at a crowded home in Los Angeles and killed a rival Jamaican gang member, resulting in a shootout between rival gangs.

Keith Kroeker shot his wife and three young children before setting their house and barn ablaze and killing himself. No noted stressors, small town, family was known to be very religious (Christian); he was an elder in the church.

Briddell was at Club 66 nightclub with his girlfriend; one of the four victims offered her a ride home, which began an altercation with Briddell, who then open fired on the victim and his friends. No indication that he knew any of them. He was on bail for a similar homicide at a nightclub the year prior.

McVay came to his girlfriend's cousin's house and shot/stabbed four to death, leaving the 3 year old daughter of his girlfriend's cousin alive. He later returned to the scene when police arrived, and pretended to be a normal concerned citizen. Past history of arson and prison, possible domestic violence

Armande was a local druggie/dealer who went to his friend's apartment and killed him after realizing he had used his drugs. He then went to a nearby apartment with other friends, known cocaine dealers, asked to use their bathroom, and then shot them all point blank in the head, presumably stealing the drugs.

Nengmy Vang was going through a contentious divorce with his wife, Naly. He demanded that she immediately grant him the divorce within 24 hours or he would kill her; he came back and killed two of her coworkers before going to kill her lawyer (Naly was hiding at this point). After killing her lawyer, he returned home to his apartment and engaged in a three hour standoff with police, killing a cop before being killed. Vang had a history of emotional abuse towards his wife, marital problems, potential mental illness, and financial issues.
Vasquez bludgeoned his wife and two kids to death and stabbed his niece before fleeing to his cousin's house and telling him that he had done something terrible. No other information on motive.
Harris targeted four people after his father was killed the night before, presumably related to gang violence.

Simmons and Philip were serving long sentences for double homicide (not together) and decided to kill their dormmates because they were annoying, they were bored, and they wanted to get on death row to end being in prison.

A mother and her two children were missing on April 23rd, 2017. Police found the three of them in different locations, as well as the mother's uncle dead in his home. Her supposed live-in boyfriend confessed to the crimes.
DuPree was friends with the victims and was staying at their house at the time of the murders. He shot the four victims, ransacked the house, and stole their car.
Stephen Paddock, a multimillionaire professional gambler, set up shop in the Mandelay Bay hotel and open fired on concert goers, killing 58.

Stanley Ford is accused of setting three fires from 2016 to 2017, including one car fire (no deaths), a house fire that killed 2 adults, and another house fire of his neighbor that killed 7. He is facing the death penalty, but claims he should not be because the police chief used racist terms to describe him on TV.

Willie Godbolt's wife had left him 3 weeks prior. He went to her mother's house, where she and their two children were staying, to get custody of the kids back. They called the local deputy, which prompted Godbolt to start firing; he killed three family members and the deputy while his wife and children escaped. He then forced two different individuals to drive him around in different cars, and shot and killed four more people in 2 homes. He was shot during the process and claimed that his intention had been suicide by cop.

Neumann was a disgruntled employee that had a previous history of arguing with coworkers, and even had the police called on him at work in 2014 for battering a coworker; no charges were filed. After being fired from his job, Neumann went back to Fiamma Inc and targeted specific coworkers, killing five before himself

Damian Herrera got into an argument with his stepfather about using his pickup truck. He then shot and killed his stepfather, his half brother, and mother when the latter two tried to intervene. His sister escaped. He stole the pickup and fled, eventually killing another man to steal his truck. He then continued to a general store to get gas, and killed another man there as well (unclear if to take his vehicle). He was caught in a police chase that ended in a crash. Currently incompetent to stand trial.

Four assailants broke into the home of a federally-licensed gun salesman (who ran his business from his home), killing the salesman, his wife, and a couple that were visiting to play cards. Robbery was the motive and police believe it was gang related.

Orion Krause abruptly left home in Maine, prompting his mother to call the police, fearing he was going to commit suicide. He later called her and told her he was in Massachusetts, so she drove to pick him up and swung by her parents house to visit them. Orion called his former college professor to say that he thought he might have to kill his mother. Orion then killed his mother, grandparents, and their caretaker with a baseball bat. He then stripped naked and covered himself in mud, and ran to a neighbors house to confess.
Three known members of the Satan's Disciples gang plus one of their ex-girlfriends were shot in a vehicle by another gang retaliating for a hit two nights earlier. Currently unsolved.
Two offenders killed a friend and her domestic partner as well as their kids to steal an x-box and a TV

Scott Kologi, a 16 year old who was homeschooled by his mother and reportedly had an autism spectrum disorder, killed his parents, sister, and grandfather's girlfriend in their family home on New Year's Eve.

Alec Perez had repeatedly abused his recent wife, and she had gotten a restraining order against him. He threatened to kill her, and told her he'd be back with the right people. He and Ortiz murdered her and three others.

Aaron Lawson shot/stabbed four people listed as family members, and stabbed another family member (who survived and alerted police). He raped Staci and was also charged with abuse of a corpse. He was on the lamb when he was arrested.

Joseph Nickell had recently lost his sister to drug addiction, and had a history of substance abuse and domestic violence. He drove to his parent's house, where he killed them, before attempting to kill his son. He then drove 7 miles to his girlfriend's home, and killed her and her mother before committing suicide. Noted interest in guns and was a conservative Christian.

George Davis, on parole, went to a gas station in the morning and got into an argument with the mother of his child, killing her, her passenger, and another male witness. He then went to his cousin's home and killed him before fleeing; he killed himself in Ohio.

Travis Reinking had a history of paranoia and mental illness: he believed that he was being stalked by Taylor Swift and his phone was being hacked; he crashed a pool party in a pink dress (with his rifle in the trunk) before exposing himself to the partygoers; and he attempted to break into the White House to get a meeting with President Trump. After being arrested by the Secret Service, his gun license was revoked, and the guns were turned over to his father. When he wanted to move out of state, his father returned the weapons to Reinking, who used them to kill 4 people at the Waffle House...while naked.
incidents.weapon: Used an AR-15 style rifle; after attempting to get into the White House in 2017, his firearms license was revoked, but his father took possession of his four guns, including the murder weapon

incidents.narrative: Justin Painter had been married for over six years. When he filed for divorce, he got a temporary restraining order against his wife, was awarded primary custody of their three children, and was being paid child support by his wife. After attempting to reconcile, he killed the children and her boyfriend and attempted to kill her before committing suicide. No history of DV, although wife claims that he was mentally ill.

Dwight Jones had a history of mental illness and domestic violence. He had used abusive language towards his son, and then beat up his wife. After his arrest for DV, he was court-ordered to undergo a mental health evaluation and was involuntarily committed to a behavioral health facility. After nine years, he posted a YouTube video detailing his beliefs that there was a conspiracy between his ex-wife, psychiatrist, the law firm, and the local government to keep his son away from him. He then killed his psychiatrist, two paralegals who worked for his wife's law firm, a man that happened to be renting the office of a therapist that saw his son, and two friends.

In 2011, Jarrod Ramos pled guilty to criminal harrassment of a former high school classmate, and The Capital wrote an article about it. He later filed a defamation lawsuit but lost, and began to harrass the newspaper and specific employees online. He repeatedly posted threats hoping that staff members would die, and at least one staff member attempted to get a restraining order. In 2016, he ceased making threats, but then two years later came to the newspaper's office and shot five before being arrested.

A man was recently estranged from his wife and had lost his local job, working instead out of state. Their oldest son had Williams syndrome. He killed his wife and three young children before committing suicide.

Richard Starry killed two in-laws at a home owned by himself and his father before heading to a local nursing home to kill his father and stepmother and commit suicide. Starry had served 4 years in prison for drug trafficking and had been charged with money laundering (those were dropped however). One sources notes that he became a white supramacist in prison and owned 200+ guns, and suggests that the motive may have been related to a property dispute between father and son.
incidents.weapon: one handgun noted

incidents.narrative: Ronnie Rodriguez Jr and Sr were at a the birthday party of a one-year-old relative when Juan Espinoza Sr drove by the home. The Rodriguezs confronted him, accusing him of being a peeping tom, and he drove off, returning with his family members. Rodriguez Jr started shooting but missed, and his father grabbed the gun, shooting the five men, killing four and wounding one.
incidents.weapon: one handgun

incidents.narrative: Cindy Collier had been married for nearly 30 years. In 2007, she separated from her husband, and raised their 7 children alone (3 biological, 4 adopted from China). She was described as a loving, Christian mother who homeschooled her children. She shot and killed her four adopted children, leaving a suicide note, before killing herself. One of her adult biological children found them. In the months prior, she was having some arguments with her estranged husband about custody (during divorce proceedings that were later dropped). She was molested by her parents as a child.
incidents.weapon: 34 rounds fired; multiple guns used, at least one shotgun

incidents.narrative: Henry Lee Stringer, then 34, torched a house, killing his two young kids. Firefighters also found their mother and grandmother fatally stabbed. He accepted life in prison without a chance for parole to avoid the death penalty but offered no explanation.

Robert Bowers was a high school dropout who started out as a conservative, but became active in neo-nazi circles online (especially Gab, and worked as an archivist for James Quinn on a volunteer basis). He believed in the white genocide conspiracy theory, made many anti-Semetic and racist remarks and eventually shot and killed 11 people at a synagogue.
incidents.weapon: 3 Glock handguns and one Colt AR-15 assault rifle

incidents.narrative: Ian David Long was an honorably discharged Marine Corps vet who moved in with his mother following the end of his service. Neighbors reported that he often fought loudly with his mother, and once called the police because he was acting erraticly. A mental health professional who observed him following this incident suggested that he may be suffering from PTSD, but declined to bring him in for further observation. He was described as a loner by some, and a nice guy by his friends. He had previously frequented the Borderline Bar and Grill on multiple occassions.
incidents.weapon: Glock 21 0.45 caliber semi-automatic pistol with laser sight and seven banned HCM

incidents.narrative: Two stepbrothers were renovating a house when they found a small stash of drugs. One of the brothers contacted one of the offenders, attempting to sell the drugs. The offenders then attempted to rob the brothers, but wound up executing everyone in the home.

Richard Emery had been dating Kate Kasten for approximately a year and a half. Her husband had passed away after a six-year battle with cancer about six months prior to the beginning of their relationship. He had moved into their home, and no one reported any signs of domestic violence, conflict, or mental illness. He shot and killed his girlfriend, her two children, and her mother before fleeing in a vehicle. When stopped by police, he shot at the officers and ran off on foot, attempting to carjack a woman. When her car wouldn't start, he stabbed her (nonfatally) and was eventually caught the next morning in a convenience store bathroom, suffering from two bullet wounds. No indications of a motive.

Lovequawn Scott was raised by his grandparents. He did well in school and was liked by classmates. He later played football at two different colleges, but was kicked out for drugs/weapons offenses. It is unclear if Lovequawn had a history of mental illness; he appeared at a church and at an urgent care center where his cousin worked the day before the murders, asking for help. He beat his grandparents, his aunt, and his cousin (who was like a sister to him) to death with dumbbells before being arrested with a hand injury and blood all over him.

Charles DuBois was unemployed, living at home, and had a known drug abuse problem. He had previously suffered from suicidal thoughts, and was taken to emergency psychiatric care two weeks prior to the incident. He intentionally lit two fires at home in the middle of the night while his family slept. He attempted to use the insanity defense but then later recanted it. No motive clear.

Zephen Xaver had a history of being fascinated with violence, and had previously been kicked out of high school for dreaming of committing a school shooting, taking hostages, and dying by suicide by cop. He moved from IN to FL and was living with his mother. He expressed an interest in violent videogames and goth music. He had dropped out of online college a month prior to the shooting, and resigned his job as a correctional officer trainee two weeks prior. After killing four employees and a customer at Suntrust bank, he called the police to let them know that he had killed five people, but barricaded himself inside the bank.
incidents.weapon: Purchased a 9mm handgun days before incident; was wearing bulletproof vest at time

incidents.narrative: Gamble was on parole, and came to his estranged cousin's home. Without saying anything, he shot his two cousins and his aunt, killing 2/3, and then drove to his best friend's apartment, killing his friend and his friend's girlfriend. He fled to Indiana where he was apprehended. No other details.

Upset over payroll deductions for child support, Herbert Chalmers Jr. 54, killed his ex-wife and an ex-girlfriend. He took a bus to the caterer where he was considered a good worker and killed the co-owner, her daughter and himself.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Three years after disability retirement for psychological problems, Jennifer Sanmarco, 44, killed a former neighbor. She then returned to her postal workplace to fatally shoot six people before killing herself, all with a legally purchased handgun.
incidents.weapon:
Handgun - Smith & Wesson model 915 - 9mm with 15-round capacity. 



Handgun purchased at Ace Pawn and Antiques in Grants, N.M., and an unspecified amount of ammunition from a pawn shop in Gallup, N.M., said Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Department, sheriff's Sgt. Erik Raney



Paul Castillo, owner of the pawn shop, said San Marco bought the gun for $325. The gun originally was purchased by another person in San Jose and later sold to the pawn shop, Raney said.

incidents.narrative: Seven people were shot or stabbed in a Forsyth County farmhouse. Four died. Convicted: Jason McGhee, sentenced to life without parole; and Frank Ortegon, sentenced to 20 years in prison.  Marcin W. Sosniak was sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: Walther P99 .40-caliber pistol S&W/11 round mag (Serial # - 462553)– knives too

incidents.narrative: Arson trapped a mother and her two kids in an apartment building. Another woman died jumping from the fourth floor. Six years later, prosecutors charged Samuel Martinez with murder but have cut his bail to $1 and said they may seek dismissal of charges.

Nam Le (Vietnamese) owned a nail salon with his wife, and several family members worked there. He shot and killed his wife, sister-in-law, sister-in-law's fiance, and a family friend/babysitter in his home during a 12 hour standoff with police. Several hours into the standoff, he released his two children (4 and 5) unharmed to the police. He was shot by a sniper and later died at the hospital. No known motive. Everyone seemed to like him and says that they will miss him.

Gary Martin had a long history of domestic violence, and had been in prison for stabbing an ex-girlfriend in 1995. He was able to apply successfully for an Illinois FOID card due to the lack of fingerprinting, but failed to secure a concealed carry permit, and was sent a letter indicating that he had to give up his guns and FOID card. It remains unclear if the police ever followed up on his illegal gun ownership. After working at Henry Pratt company for 15 years, he went to a meeting where he was told he was being fired. During the meeting, he shot his coworkers/boss, and hid in the 29,000 sq ft factory until police found him, and exchanged gunfire, killing him.
incidents.weapon: Martin applied for an IL FOID card in 2014 and received one, because IL does not require fingerprinting. When he later applied for a concealed carry permit, he was rejected due to his felony assault in MS, and was sent a letter requiring him to relinquish his handgun and FOID card. Unclear if the police ever followed up. The gun was a Smith and Wesson 0.40 caliber with a laser scope

incidents.narrative: Randy Horn, an amateur boxer and poker enthusiast, killed his wife (27 years his junior), their child, and her two grandparents after posting an ominous message on facebook. No clear motive.

Dakota Theriot had a "violent streak" and a known problem with drugs. Two weeks prior to the incident, he was kicked out of his parents' trailer for his drug problem, and went to live with Summer Ernest, his girlfriend of a few weeks, with her family. It appears that there was some sort of dispute, and he killed his girlfriend and her family (but let her two young siblings live) before stealing their car, driving to his parent's house, and killing them. He then drove to his grandmother's home, where police apprehended him during a wellness check (she called in afraid he would come for her next).

Four related men were shot and killed inside an injured victim's home. The police believe the incident was related to drugs, as drugs and weapons were found in the home. The victims knew their attacker, but the case remains unsolved.

DeWayne Craddock, a 15-year employee with no criminal history, submitted his two weeks notice to the Virginia Beach Municipal Government citing "personal reasons." He then went on a rampage at work a few hours later, killing 12 and injuring 5.
incidents.weapon: 0.45 caliber ACP pistols (two), suppressor, and HCM found near shooter; unconfirmed reports of a rifle, legally obtained

incidents.narrative: Hersel M. Isadore Jr., 28, was "depressed and acting irrationally" in the weeks before he fatally shot his longtime girlfriend, four of their children and a cousin, according to a police report. Isadore then commited suicide.
incidents.weapon: Revolver

incidents.narrative: Seung-Hui Cho, an "angry and disturbed" Virginia Tech senior, killed two students in a dorm before entering classrooms and shooting others. Thirty-two people died. A review found that Cho's mental health history should have prevented him from buying guns.
incidents.weapon: Glock 19 9mm semiautomatic pistol and a Walther P22 .22 caliber semiautomatic pistol - in his backback her carried almost 400 rounds of ammunition most of which were in rapid loading magazines, a knife, heavy chains, and a hammer.

incidents.narrative: In January 2007, police found the bodies of four homeless men dumped in manholes.They apparently had stolen scrap metal from the suspects. Daniel Joseph Sharp pleaded guilty and is serving a 65-year sentence. Randy Lee Reeder received a sentence of 260 years.
incidents.weapon: Hammer-like weapon

incidents.narrative: Two children were among the victims of a shooting in what police described as a "known narcotics location." All four victims were shot as they slept. Patrick Albert Young Smith was found guilty of four counts of murder and sentenced to life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Assault rifle

incidents.narrative: Terrance Robinson, 22, went into the house, stayed a few minutes, left briefly and returned to shoot two men and two women, possibly because of an earlier dispute. He was sentenced to eight life terms without the chance for parole.
incidents.weapon: “Handgun” – Also, Gunn (witness) admits writing the note that told the woman to give him money, drugs and the ".38 cal gun," but contends Robinson signed it and added his nickname, Sandman." (KC Star) – (FOIA will confirm…hopefully, but they must have found that caliber as the same as murder weapon or why bother? – mh)

incidents.narrative: Authorities say a family dispute over an inheritance left four family members dead. Felton Bernard received a life sentence in the shootings of his uncles, an aunt and her boyfriend. Corey Berniard was sentenced to 30 years in prison.

Auto mechanic Raymond Oyler, 37, was convicted of setting a wildfire that killed five federal firefighters. The 60-square-mile Esperanza fire also destroyed 54 homes and other buildings. He was sentenced to death in 2009.
incidents.weapon: Fire

incidents.narrative: Someone twice set fire to a trailer in a mobile home park. On the third try, five of 10 occupants died, in part because the owners had covered windows with wire mesh. They settled survivors' claims for $6 million. The case remains unsolved.

Richard Wilkinson didn't get along with his daughter and son-in-law, who lived with him. He argued with her and told friends they were stealing. One night, he shot them and his two grandsons, ages 3 and 6. As police entered his home, he killed himself.
incidents.weapon: 2 handguns.

incidents.narrative: Luke Karpinski appeared to be a loving family man, but he killed his wife and 3 kids before killing himself and lighting their house on fire. Their 2 dogs also died.

Gurpreet Singh called 911 ro report that four members of his well-respected Sikh family were found shot dead in their home while preparing food. Two moths later he was arrested for the murders of his wife and three other relatives. The couple's three children were not at home at the time.

Michael Cummins had a history of violence and drug problems. After being released from a year in jail for attempting to burn down his neighbor's house and assaulting her, Cummins violated his parole and was about to be arrested. He killed three family members and his uncle's girlfriend and relatives before attacking another woman, presumably to steal her car. He was found by police in a creek bed by the home, and was shot before being taken into custody.

Investigators say Matthew Blixt 17, used his father's gun to shoot his father, his father's girlfriend and the woman's two daughters before turning the gun on himself. Friends said Blixt was upset that his father, separated from his mother, was dating.
incidents.weapon: Handgun - HI-Point 9mm semiautomatic handgun (recovered at scene) – the gun was his fathers.  A ballistic analysis found all the expended casings and projectiles found at the scene came from that gun.

incidents.narrative: An ex-husband dressed up as Santa Claus and went to his former in-laws' home during a Christmas Eve party. He shot and killed his ex-wife and members of her family before setting the house ablaze. Nine died. The killer committed suicide.
incidents.weapon:
Total: (5) Sig-Sauer Model P226 semiautomatic 9mm handguns - 4 left at scene; 1 taken with Pardo offsite.  Lt. Tim Doonan, Covina Police Department.



Of those 5, Autopsy report confirms make, model, caliber and serial number of two.  

 (1)Sig-Sauer Model P226 semiautomatic 9mm handgun, serial number U777822. one round in the chamber, 15 in the magazine. Luger +P 9mm jacketed hollow point bullets.

(1)Sig-Sauer Model P226 semiautomatic 9mm handgun, serial number U459976. One round in the chamber, magazine empty.

(3) Sig-Sauer Model P226 semiautomatic 9mm handguns – two left at scene and one taken offsite



Incendiary Device - Home-made high-octane racing fuel spraying. No ignition device onboard.  Pardo had sprayed racing fuel, intending to ignite it with a flare. But flames in two fireplaces triggered an explosion. He was severely burned.

incidents.narrative: A retaliatory shooting at a Fourth of July street party killed four and injured two others. Antonio D. "Cheem" Williams and James R. Washington were sentenced to life in prison. Rosario C. Fuentez pleaded guilty and got 20 years.
incidents.weapon: .45-caliber handgun and 2 SKS AK-47 assault rifles

incidents.narrative: Three men and two women were shot in the head and killed during a Chicago burglary. Suspects stole money, jewelry and TVs, police said. Torolan Williams and Michael King were found guilty and face life in prison. Arthur Brown was sentenced to 24 years.

Two teenagers were forced to watch the slayings of their mother and stepfather. Three others were shot, two fatally, at a hospital. Police said Frank Garcia was angry at co-workers whose complaints had twice gotten him fired. Garcia was sentenced to life.
incidents.weapon: .40-caliber Glock pistol. Investigators found in his home a Kel-Tech semiautomatic pistol with a magazine containing seven rounds in a cupboard above stove, where a .380 magazine with a belt clip loaded with seven rounds was also stashed. Boxes of ammunition found in a lower kitchen cupboard. "High Noon" holsters found in another cupboard. A 12-gauge shotgun and a container with 103 .40-caliber rounds were found in second-floor storage area.

incidents.narrative: Matthew Murray, 24, was dropped from the missionary program of New Life Church in Arvada, Colo. Five years later, he returned and shot two people then drove 80 miles to the evangelical church itself, where he killed two others before committing suicide.
incidents.weapon: Bushmaster X15 .223-caliber rifle, Beretta .40-caliber handgun, Springfield Armory 9mm handgun. Killer fired 26 shots. Also: Left AK-47 in car. Also: .22-caliber Beretta handgun and bomb-making parts found in apartment.

incidents.narrative: A couple and their two young sons vanished from their home in 2010. In November 2013, authorities discovered their bodies in shallow graves outside Victorville, Calif., and a year later charged one victim's business partner, Charles Merritt, with murder.
incidents.weapon: 3-pound Stanley sledgehammer used as a weapon.

incidents.narrative: A white gunman killed nine people, including a pastor, attending a prayer meeting at a historic black church. Dylann Storm Roof, 21, was charged with murder and federal hate crimes. He was convicted and sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: Glock .45-caliber model 41 semiautomatic handgun – bought with money given to him by his father in April for his 21st birthday. Law enforcement confirms make and model.

incidents.narrative: Hours after police responded to a domestic violence call at the home, the estranged husband shot his wife and her two children, as well as her father. The father survived until Dec. 4, 2015, making his the fourth death. The offender took his own life.
incidents.weapon: gun

incidents.narrative: After a lengthy mental evaluation, Everett Conant III was ruled competent. He pleaded no contest to murder in the killings of his three sons and their uncle, and one count of attempted murder in the shooting of his wife. He will serve life in prison.
incidents.weapon: Two 9-mm pistols - approx 50 rounds fired -  a shotgun and a semi-automatic rifle were found in the home - Spec. Agt. Len Propps of the Wyoming Division of Criminal Investigation.

incidents.narrative: Three brothers and a cousin were shot  on their patio while watching a Los Angeles Lakers game on TV. Police have said the shooting is gang-related. It has not been solved.
incidents.weapon: Semiautomatic Rifle – Press accounts have it as a “semiautomatic weapon”.  PIO says it was a “high-power rifle” and another press account says, firing was “continuous.”  If the rifle were a shotgun or hunting rifle (non-semiautomatic weapons) , firing would not be “continuous”) – Team concurs with labeling this weapon a “semiautomatic rifle”

incidents.narrative: Adam Lanza, 20, killed his mother at their Newtown, Conn., home, then drove to nearby Sandy Hook Elementary School. He forced his way in and killed six adults and 20 children with a rifle, firing 154 shots. He killed himself with a handgun.
incidents.weapon:
One (1) .223-caliber Bushmaster XM15-E2S rifle (primary weapon – used to kill all except the gunman - 30 round magazine was recovered with the rifle – 154 bullets shot (prosecutors office)



One (1) 1Glock Model 20 SF – Suicide weapon - Serial #SN-SMA461 - search warrant finds paperwork entitled "Connecticut Gun Exchange Glock 20SF 10mm" ( no Glock found at home so….) and finds “(2) spent shell casings from factory for Glock 10mm, Serial #SN-SMA461”



One (1) Sig-Sauer P226 9mm handgun (unused)



One (1) Savage Mark II .22 caliber rifle - serial #1605038 – Weapon which kills Mom.



One (1) Izhmash Saiga 12 Shotgun, serial #H084002282 (AK-47 styled shotgun – in car – unused) - The Saiga 12, depending on configuration, can fire any number of gauge shells.  All shotgun ammo found as a result of the Search Warrant were 12-gauge.



 Guns purchased legally by suspect's mother.

incidents.narrative: An oilfield worker killed the mother of his child, then went across town to kill her brother, mother and mother's boyfriend. Omar Kalmio, 27, spared his infant daughter. He will remain in prison for life without the chance for parole.
incidents.weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun - no gun found but shell casings at crime scene confirm same gun fired all.

incidents.narrative: A domestic shooting turned public when the gunman left home, carjacked a woman, shot at other vehicles, and then entered the campus of Santa Monica College with a semi-automatic rifle. Police shot John Zawahri, 23, in a standoff in the school's library.
incidents.weapon: a .223-caliber AR-15-style assault rifle - looks like a Bushmaster - spare barrel; .44-caliber revolver, 20 magazines loaded with 1,300 rounds of ammunition, boxes of extra bullets, and wearing a tactical vest (bullet-proof)

incidents.narrative: A 22-year-old college student frustrated over sexual rejections promised in a video to "annihilate" women "on the day of retribution." Elliot Rodger, who was found dead, is suspected of the shootings that killed six and wounded seven others.
incidents.weapon: (3) 9mm semiautomatic handguns – (2) Sig Sauer P226 pistols (1), Glock 34 Long Slide – found in the car according to police along with 41 magazines with 10 rounds each - Santa Barbara County Sheriff Bill Brown - all bought legally at local gun stores.

incidents.narrative: Police said Jody Hunt, 39, drove to three locations around Morgantown and shot an ex-girlfriend, a cousin and two other acquaintances. He was found that evening in his pickup truck, an apparent suicide. Hunt, a convicted felon, bought his handgun online.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm semi-automatic handgun (with shoulder stock) was purchased by another man legally from a licensed dealer 4 years ago. Hunt, a convicted felon, purchased it from that man online. Sheriffs declined to prosecute the man because he didn't know Hunt was a felon.

incidents.narrative: Four children, their mother and grandfather died in a house fire that critically injured their father. Court documents say Ryan Williams was angry that the father had turned him in to police on a theft charge. Williams was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.

A radicalized Islamic married couple opened fire at a holiday office party in San Bernardino, Calif., killing 14 and injuring 21. They were shot dead by police later that afternoon; an arsenal of weapons, ammunition and bombs were found in their home.
incidents.weapon: (1) DPMS .223 semi-automatic rifle; (1) Smith & Wesson MMP15 .223 semi-automatic rifle; (1) Smith & Wesson 9mm semi-automatic handgun; (1) Llama semi-automatic handgun;  Thousands of rounds of ammo for both on their person, in their rented SUV and at their home.  At the IRC there were three pipe bombs attached to a remote-controlled toy car.   Their home also contained 8 pipe bombs and parts and tools to make more.

incidents.narrative: Reginald Hester had made a deal with a woman living in an apartment building to have sex for $10. After taking his money, the woman went back into her apartment and did not come back out, so Hester started a fire that killed four.

Holmes was recently divorced with three children and was unemployed despite having a college degree in criminal justice. She went to three separate locations to kill her recent boyfriend, sister, and mother/stepfather.

Two young girls lured five teenage boys suspected of being in a rival gang or having previously insulted the MS-13 into a park at night. They texted MS-13 gang members, who arrived with machetes, clubs, and knives, and the group killed four of the boys (the fifth escaped). Suspected 12-15 members were involved, but only 4 charged thus far.

Devin Kelley had a history of warning signs, including DV, sexual assault, prison time, military experience and obsession with weapons, obsession with previous mass shootings, restraining order, treatment in a mental health facility, etc. He went to his estranged wife's family's church and killed 25, including her grandmother. A citizen exchanged gunfire with him and pursued him, so he committed suicide and crashed his car.

Offender planned the attack for almost a year; moved from Uzebekistan where he was an accountant after winning Green Card in 2010; got married, had kids, worked for Uber. Rented a truck from Home Depot and drove into bike lane to hit riders/pedestrians. Claimed it was for ISIS.

Timothy Smith went to a car wash in the middle of the night to engage in a fight with his ex-girlfriend's new boyfriend. While the victims believed it was supposed to be a fistfight, Smith killed them all before committing suicide. It is unclear when he and Chelsie Cline broke up; her sister says a few months prior, whereas the estranged wife of Porterfield says that it was two days prior to the incident. Smith was described as obsessed with Cline, bringing her flowers when she was sick, etc. She had recently posted on facebook that she needed to be taken out on a date or by a sniper, and Smith commented "I can do both."
incidents.weapon: Had 3 guns, including 9mm handgun, AR-15 .223 calliber assault rifle, and .308 calliber rifle; did not use the .308 during the attack. Had multiple magazines, was wearing body armor without the ballistic panels inserted, and shot approximately 30 times

incidents.narrative: Gary Lindsey had a history of violent, erratic behavior. After the end of a five-year relationship, he stabbed his ex fiance's TV and then lit her house on fire, claiming that it was going to be his "grave." He had a history of aggravated assault, shoplifting, and many domestic violence charges (for which he served some jail time). He was living in an apartment with his girlfriend, their two children, and her other two children. He had previously beaten her, knocked their 7 month old out of her hands, and held a knife to her throat. DCF had come to investigate several times, but found that the children were not in danger. When his gf called the police this time, he shot an officer (who survived), barricaded himself inside with the children, and then killed them after a 24-hour standoff with police before killing himself.
incidents.weapon: he had 2 rifles, 2 shotguns, and a handgun given to him by his deceased father; unclear which if any were used

incidents.narrative: Matthew Locke apparently killed his cousin's wife, Sara, and his cousin's children, while Moses Bermudez (said cousin) was working out of state. No motive has been offered, but the police initially charged him with lying about an investigation, as he claimed that Moses had insinuated that MS-13 was responsible for the murders. He also apparently lied about his relationship with Sara (not sure yet what that relationship was) and was in possession of drug parapernalia despite being on parole.

Paul Caneiro killed his brother and his family, presumably for a financial motive. The two brothers had established businesses together, but his brother was much more successful than Paul (bigger share of businesses, more money, bigger house, etc.) Several years prior to the incident, Paul was in a car accident that required multiple surgeries and caused immense emotional and physical pain (he was awarded a $120,000 settlement for his medical expenses). The once booming business that the brothers shared had fallen on tough times, and Keith had recently found out that Paul had stolen $75,000 from the business. Keith also indicated that he wanted to sever his business relationship with Paul, and had sent his resume to other companies, especially looking for a job in California. Paul shot and killed his brother and his sister in law before stabbing their two children. He then lit their house on fire and drove home, lighting his own home on fire to make it look like a vendetta against the extended family.

A plan to steal drugs from an acquaintance ended in his killing and the slayings of his wife and three children. Charles W. Gilleo Jr. received five life sentences without parole, while Mark S. Serrano was sentenced to 50 years to life.
incidents.weapon: Weapon(s): Remington Model 522 Rifle, .22-caliber, Serial # 3224142 (sawed-off), Knife, Blunt Force Object. Rifle purchased at Dick's Sporting Goods, Poughkeepsie, NY - Cost: $139.99 - Federal Firearm License # 6-14-014-01-BJ-34901

incidents.narrative: A woman and her boyfriend stand accused of killing her parents and then shooting her brother and his family as they arrived for Christmas Eve dinner. Michele K. Anderson and Joseph Thomas McEnroe both were sentenced to life without parole.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm handgun and .357 Magnum revolver

incidents.narrative: Paul Devoe is sentenced to death in the shootings of four in Texas. Just before killing his ex-girlfriend and others, he killed two and injured one in Pennsylvania. He initially was found incompetent to stand trial, but after medication was deemed fit. He was then convicted and sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: .38-caliber semiautomatic handgun

incidents.narrative: Four children -- ages 3 to 8 -- died in a Cleveland house fire set by a man who was angry at their mother, a former girlfriend. Lorenzo Collins, 42, was sentenced to 111 years in prison. Collins Bennett, 39, his accomplice, also was convicted and given a 16 year sentence.
incidents.weapon: Fire

incidents.narrative: Ricky Gray, 28, was convicted of murdering a family of four during a burglary. His nephew, Ray Dandridge, 28, assisted. A week later, both men killed a family of three. Dandridge was convicted in that case and was given a life sentence. Gray also confessed to murdering his wife and sentenced to death.
incidents.weapon: razor knife and "claw" hammer

incidents.narrative: Rescue units responding to a house fire found four bodies inside. All, including two children, had been shot. Police arrested James Bannister, one victim's boyfriend, who is charged with four counts of murder. He was convicted and given a life sentence.
incidents.weapon: Murder Weapon: .38 caliber or .357 caliber handgun - "The scene was later searched by deputies, detectives, and forensic personnel, and projectiles were recovered from the home. These projectiles were examined by FDLE and were determined to have been fired by either a .38 caliber or .357 caliber handgun, both of which are typically revolvers." - from Probable Cause Arrest Affidavit -Police still looking for the weapon.A witness stated: "The defendant admitted that the murder weapon was a .38 caliber weapon, and that he had since disposed of that weapon."

incidents.narrative: Police say a custody battle may have sparked the fatal shooting of eight people at a beauty salon. Scott Dekraai pleaded guilty in May 2014 and sentenced to life without parole in the slayings of his ex-wife and others, including a man parked outside the shop.
incidents.weapon: 9 mm Springfield, Smith & Wesson .44 Magnum, Heckler & Koch .45-caliber

incidents.narrative: Javier Casarez's 28-year marriage ended four months prior when he believed that his wife was cheating on him (potentially with two of the male victims). His ex-wife claimed a history of verbal abuse, and asked for spousal and child support in addition to the family home. Casarez presumably forced his ex wife to go to his workplace, where he killed her and two others before driving to the home of a man that had loaned him money in 2010, killing that man and his daughter. The young children in the home were unharmed. He then carjacked a mother and child, telling them that he is "not a bad guy" before letting them go. When confronted by police, he committed suicide.
incidents.weapon: Smith and Wesson 500 0.5 caliber handgun, legally purchased in 2004

Sanford had been convicted of this crime, but was exonerated in 2016 and released from custody.
